Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

B6lyz9g3TUXZC5NX1Dmy0Q.text: I always like to start with the good so I will say that this place offers great people watching and the gawking factor definitely gets high marks. If you are looking to drink cocktails and view the work of Scottsdale's finest plastic surgeons, this is the place for you. If you are expecting a nice restaurant, not so much.   We arrived at the restaurant and it appeared that there was only valet parking available. At first we were ignored, but were finally informed that valet parking was closed. However, it was open to the BMW behind us. Thankfully we were not driving an old car or they might have called the police to remove our apparent poorness from the parking lot.   We stepped inside the restaurant where the DJ stands next to the host. Apparently this is a warning that loud techno music will inhibit patrons' ability to have a conversation. I told the host that we had a reservation for 7:30 pm and he said that it was for 6 pm and they couldn't hold the table that long. There was some back and forth here as I explained that someone from our party received a confirmation call from the restaurant earlier that day for the reservation we had for 7:30. In the end, the host was only a little condescending and that could be my fault because I didn't get the memo about this being a "dress-up" kind of restaurant and arrived wearing business casual.   After about a 30 minute wait, we were seated at a table so small that four of us were seated on the corners and we were so close to the bar behind us that every time a server walked by we all got bumped. Our server arrived to take our drink order and we, all 10 of us, were trying to get a look at the cocktail menu. We asked for an additional cocktail menu but were told there were no more.   Our entrees arrived one at a time and every food and drink item was delivered by a server standing at the head of the table and yelling "Who ordered the___!!" That was fantastic as we must have ordered 40 things between drinks, appetizers, and entrees. Considering the price of the food, I think I can reasonably expect the wait staff to remember to which position the food should be delivered.   As for the food itself, some things were good, like the tacos and the rock shrimp. Some things were really bad, like the ramen and the chicken mole. The portions were small, but this was expected.   There are some really fantastic restaurants in Scottsdale where you can get awesome food and excellent service. Also, you can generally get a viewing of the same beautiful people just about anywhere in Scottsdale. Go to the places where you can get the 3-in-1.

xbZi8VuZnPIPVUlVdEe_hg.text: Please close down.  Reservation at 7:30 on the patio.  Got there on time.  Finally seated at 8:00 inside.  Way too noisy for a restaurant.  Actually this is a bar trying to be a restaurant.  Manager offered complementary guacamole, which was actually added to the bill.    We moved from inside to the patio at 8:30 and then finally served at 9:00.  2 of the 4 meals came out at the same time, then another 10 minutes later, then another 10 minutes after that.  Waitress tells the table that food comes out when the chef finishes making it.  Not necessarily at the same time.  Got out of there at 10:00.  What a disaster.  Food as okay but not great.  Kind of a gitchy idea of combining Asian and Mexican but only okay.  Service was lousy.  Really really really lousy.  No idea of how to take care of customers.    If you like a bar setting with really huge tv's then this may be your place.  As for the food, 2 of the 4 people thought it was good. 1 was way too bland.  The dish was some sushi thing with raspberry sauce.  Nearly puked it was so bad.  The other not so good dish would have been okay had it not taken nearly 45 minutes to arrive.  The inside is nicely decorated.  But more like a pick up bar than a restaurant.  Too many plastic faces standing around waiting to be recognized.  More like L.A. than Scottsdale.    Wait staff need to be trained.  Don't have a clue about how to treat customers.    To top it off, woke up with a huge migraine which I never get.  I can only think they use some crap in their food like MSG or something.    Prices too high for what it is.  So many other good places worth the money, not this place.  Please stop embarrassing Scottsdale with this attempt at fusion of Asian and Mexican.

rXs74KKxr8YdkPlwKnhKwQ.text: Nothing better. Food, service, ambiance, it's a total food experience. Go and order lots!

3-raOEsafIPL6yjJClrKFw.text: Sushi AND tacos!! The edamame is the BEST I have ever had! Great menu. Great wines (even from Napa) variety of things to eat. Good happy hour.

3kTMpg8UmQGqySHaP-hzVg.text: Love the menu! Super creative fusion ideas pairing asian and mexican. Had the salmon ceviche, bacon wrapped dates and then spicy tuna tacos... Fantastic flavors! And the service was impeccable and helpful.

NE31tMIyMQk1x3Mt_zbRqQ.text: ORDER THE CHARRED EDAMAME!! It comes with a miso butter that is like  heaven. I ordered a California role and the crab was really fishy and not that good but the edamame and miso butter helped the taste in my mouth. Also their side salad is very good because it has a great spice on it that pops in your mouth! YUM! Great atmosphere and "club-like" vibe.

DDP-pNtDS8OE941fw89IBQ.text: Incredible, incredible flavors. We were a large party and gave our server a price per head. She brought us a seemingly non-stop variety of dishes from Filet to Shrimp to Sea Bass.  There were guacamole varieties that blew us away. This is a must if you like the flavors of Mexican and or Asian cuisine.

DnkeRfXqoxLQUDw9eJ1Lzg.text: I would describe SumoMayo as an adventurous Asian Mexican Fusion experience. We especially loved the Crispy Chicken Mole which included plantains and a flavorful mole sauce. The bacon guacamole was made with pork belly that added the perfect texture to make it interesting. My personal favorite was the Apple Salmon sumo roll which had the perfect blend of spices that elevated the sushi to levels completely unexpected.

I9OA7hm-GzUD1XzVpRRkYw.text: The food tasted good - but the dining experience and service left a lot to be desired.  I went to Sumo Maya last night for the first time. I was invited out to meet a fiend for her B-day. When we got there at about 8:15pm the place was packed and thumpin' like a night club. Wall to wall people and barely an inch to squeeze by.   We found our group seated at a large table, they had already been there since 6:00pm and had been eating and drinking all night, so I had some catching up to do. Couldn't find the waitress or waiter - whoever was looking after our table for 20 minutes, so I fought my way upstream to the bar where I squeezed in and out of people at my attempt to get a drink. As expected the bar was slammed and everyone working there was super busy and it was next to impossible to get a drink order in. Finally got the attention of a bartender and I got my drinks rater quickly after I was able to place the order.   Went back to my table of friends and joined in the fun. I was starving and wanted to order some food. About 40 minutes in a waitress finally showed herself only because two friends at my table grabbed her because they needed to tab out and leave early. I asked if I could order and she came over once she was available. My fiance ordered the Pad Thai Pastor and I ordered the Braised Pork Belly. This is where it got awkward....  I understand busy and when restaurants are busy all you can do is wait, I am fine with that, more drinks for me! - If you could get an order in. I was excited to see that Sumo Maya is so popular, which could only mean one thing...Sumo Maya was doing something right and must be worth the wait. So wait I did.  About 30 minutes later my fiances Pad Thai came, a server - not our waitress delivered it and placed it at our table, so naturally he waited for my order to come. When it was clear that my order was nowhere and most certainly not on its way - I asked him to start eating so that his didn't go cold. I waited, I waited, and I waited....He finished his meal and I finally found our waitress and asked where my order was and she informed me that the food comes out as it is completed in the "free-flowing kitchen". This meant nothing to me except that it lends itself to an awkward dating experience when one person has their food and the other does not. I understand appetizers coming at random times to a table, but not so much something that was ordered as a entree.  The menu did state "Our unique free-form dining style is designed to heighten and arouse your senses." and not having dined at Sumo Maya before and the waitress didn't ask if we were familiar with the way in which their "free-flowing kitchen" works, I did not understand what Sumo Maya's "unique dining style" was. I thought that this disclaimer on the menu was just a fancy way of saying that everything is a-la-carte and tastes good. Not, you get it when you get it and waiting while your date finishes their entire meal and you just watch them eat is part of the heightened senses experience.  The music was so loud inside that it was next to impossible to have any conversations with anyone from our group. So while I awkwardly sat and waited for my meal all I could do was sit there and smile and watch my fiance eat his dinner. It was so darn awkward....no food, no conversation and no drinks.  A little insight from the staff when ordering would have been wonderful and probably would have prevented an awkward situation. If you go there on a date, don't expect to be fed at the same time. The portions are very small but tasty. We were both still hungry after we finished the small portion controlled meals and there was no way we were going to make a second attempt at ordering more food...so we left hungry and went on to have a real dinner somewhere else.   This place is fun and cute but probably more of a pick-up joint and drinking place than a serious restaurant. Only good for apps and drinks, if you can get them! Also...bring earplugs cause it is louder than being front row at a concert. Good Luck!

uLrwjyiMUsKLqdST86sxMA.text: We just had the best meal of our vacation.  Mike was very attentive and helpful.   The restaurant fun, colorful, and well done.   We will be back many times.

cXkPolFZ4lHoYlk9uSI-bA.text: Fantastic!   We checked it out for happy hour and I'm hooked!   The restaurant is beautiful and the menu has a great variety.   We tried the guacamole,  mushroom tacos and chicken tacos.  Everything was absolutely delicious.  I don't like super sweet drinks so the bartender suggested a coconut cocktail.  She actually made it less sweet than usual and it was perfect.   Delicious food, great drinks and fabulous happy hour prices.  What else can a girl ask for?!?  Looking forward to next time!

Fz10Snwj-5BU97I-ABPoEg.text: Perfection in Scottsdale!  Perfect food, perfect ambiance, and uber perfect service by the extraordinary Jordan!  Props to him for going above and beyond!  SumoMayo is extremely fortunate to have such an asset.  Thank you for a great evening! Caramel and cappuccino!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

rpCe94Vxf4fx9-5Fz4nfpQ.text: Absolutely amazing. Went for bottomless brunch and walked away with my mind blown. 2 hours of bottomless food. Plus add ten dollars and you get bottomless drinks as well, as long as you stick with the same drink the whole time. I went for the prickly pear mimosa and definitely took advantage of being bottomless. The price includes bottomless appetizers, sides, and dessert for the table, as well as one entree per person. We went down the menu in order to get a taste of everything. You can skip some appetizers, such a yogurt and fruit, for the more unqiue bites like pomegranate seeds guacamole and black bean hummus. Our waitress was very attentive and filled out drinks often. The entrees were hard to choose from, they all sounded amazing.  I went with the steak and eggs and was not disappointed. The bottomless brunch was an amazing experience and worth it in everyway. We went at 9 AM and the place was empty, but was completely full by the time we left at 11. Make your reservation in advanced to get your party in at a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Iv8r5kAYl5EdYFA-q5I_Hg.text: Honestly this place is a 7 out of 5. YASSS it's that good. Go for brunch you get bottomless drinks and apps plus an entree for $40. What a steal. We tried every app essentially as well as the burrito and pad Thai everything was beyond amazing. And the mimosas are legendary, 3 flavors to chose from. Outdoor and indoor seating as well as a live band during Saturday and Sunday brunch. Please note it's a lil boujee and ppl like dress up for brunch. Weird concept for me but everyone was looking gurdddd. They take reservations on open table which is honestly a god send.

YQpD-O4pLo1afjCOhCiBGg.text: Bottomless Brunch is definitely the way to go...it was like eating on a cruise but on land. You literally could order as much as you want and drink as much as you like based on their bottomless drink options for only $10 extra.  To top it off each person at the table is also able to order their own entree from a pretty large list. Everything ordered was amazing.   The service was great from start to finish. Called ahead and made a reservation because it can get busy. Our server was great and was able to keep up with our orders... I don't think we stopped ordering food, well at least that's how it felt. For example, I think we ordered about 3 rounds of desserts.  So if you're planning to visiting for Bottomless Brunch just have fun and enjoy all the food options, it's so worth it.

xpEVv6JagrMhInKes20igA.text: Their must-try dishes 1. Pomegranate guacamole  2. Mexican street corn 3. Kimchi fried rice with chicken  Good food quality and service is extremely satisfactory.  Their cocktail menu is so fancy. Lychee Cocotini and Pimms Cup stood out for us!! I went there with my girls to celebrate bachelorette which we all that was an ideal spot as the restaurant has an amazing lounge kind of vibe.  I would definitely recommend making a reservation in advance.  My only complain was during my reservation the manager/server had specified that our table will be nicely decorated with flowers before our arrival but when we got there we just got seated to a normal table. We understood it was a busy night so they must have not got a chance to set up.   Everything else was perfect!

cxSAycaYyct6GBG49iRlVw.text: Pretty cool spot to stop for dinner or a late night snack.  One of my husband's favorite place to snack.  Cocktails are always good. Sushi rolls, sashimi and nigiri are fresh and very filling.  They have ramen soups that are yummy.  We always order the kimchee fried rice - tasty!  I know they offer a bottomless brunch, but I have yet to experience it!!

ecnKZJErfYksQof6vuHa6g.text: First time here and it was... confusing? The fusion is definitely unique and the food came out quickly and tasted delicious. The confusing part was the decor (faces on the chairs?) and the "family style" dishes the wait staff really pushed but the dishes are all for small parties (of 2). We were a party of 7 and dishes were delivered to the person who ordered rather than in a family style manner.  Aside from that, the food was really tasty and those cautious about the strange fusion will pleasantly enjoy the dishes.

g-K0bGEcWgc6aL1HwFy9LQ.text: Nice place for a couple to go very upscale. The food was very good and the service was excellent

fsHqNb7ueWq4bgAjX1opOw.text: Oopsie daisy - thought I had written a review for this a while back but looks like I never got around to it until now.   I've been here maybe 2-3 times for dinner and each time, the place was packed - which is always a good sign! Yesterday, I was able to experience the brunch menu with some new friends and I thoroughly enjoyed all the offerings. For $29pp, there are unlimited shared plates, unlimited sides and 1 entree. Oh and there is dessert included in that price too!   We tried basically everything they had for shared plates except for the oatmeal. My favorites had to be the pomegranate guacamole and the black bean hummus! I could totally go for more of that hummus right now.   For sides, I believe we had the chinese sausage fried rice and the breakfast potatoes. I actually really like the side of fried rice - I had 2 servings of it. We did not enjoy the potatoes - they were a bit overcooked.  I decided on the Korean Fried Chicken Torta for my entree. It was an interesting flavor - good but not great. I wish the chicken was crunchy. I liked the presentation though! The bread used for the sandwich was underwhelming so I ended up just scraping the chicken out and ate the rest of it with the fried rice. Left the bread on the side and saved those calories for dessert!  There were 2 desserts - a cinnamon crisp and liquid cheesecake. My recommendation would be to eat those two items together. I left stuffed to the brim but would definitely visit again for brunch. I've enjoyed my previous experiences -just know that you'll be spending a bit more here to get full during dinner as portions are small. Looking forward to coming back to try more!

Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Desserts
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Korean fried chicken torta

eTwKcl7fSFTI1vKiP2JSzw.text: My daughter recommended this place & when she said it was a Mexican/Asian restaurant I was a little apprehensive, but I was wrong to feel that way.. The food and service were both amazing!   We ordered a few different items of the menu since it was not the full menu, but their Happy Hour.   The wings were extra spicy but seriously so tasty! We also ordered chicken enchiladas with pomegranate seeds, and everyone at the table loved them. Ordered a sushi roll, edamame, calamari, very good! I didn't get any pics because everyone was so hungry!   Got the mochi ice cream at the end of our meal & it was yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mochi was good, we ordered the mango &amp; strawberry flavors.

0UydrozCjZlAzchK6XpjNA.text: SumaMaya is delicious all around! Their drinks are phenomenal. Bottomless mimosas are always a plus. Their food is even more to rave about it! The Pomegranate Guac is sooooo good. But the best thing ever is the Thai curry coconut soup. I almost cried when they took the empty cup away from me!!

bpJZx9-rxalANUoJD2WnlQ.text: Where should I start? This place is so different and in the best way possible. The decor is amazing--a tree in the middle of the dining area, the acrylic clear chairs, the lounge and bar area...it's all really trendy and beautiful. I came here on a whim on a Sunday evening. I had the banana margarita which was unique and amazing. I had more of a craving for Mexican rather than Asian, so I went with ceviche as an appetizer and it was the mix ceviche with beets...soooo good! I then ordered the Korean beef tacos (AMAZING), the al pastor (even MORE AMAZING), and the street corn--even better! It was so good, the flavors, the texture, the unique ingredients--I truly enjoyed the food. I definitely can't wait to come back and try some sushi and noodles the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mexican Street Corn
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kk rean Beef Taco
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork Al Pastor Taco

VVCPloaQ3DRI8hBl09ZX1A.text: This place was awesome! We didn't have dinner reservations, and it was a Saturday night, so we sat at the bar. I asked the bartender what to order and she rocked it!   The atmosphere in this place was fun, funky, lots of people and crowd watching, very busy and a place to "see and be seen." The music was hip and our servers were are fantastic.   We got the Rainbow Ceviche, and it was divine. Tuna, salmon, hamachi, white soy, citrus and jalapeno. The flavor combinations were bursting in my mouth. I would get that every time I go there. (And they also have take out, so I would order two of them if I were in a hurry or wanted to stay home.)  Then we got the Spicy Crab Roll. That roll was a flavor fest in my mouth. Glazed crab, Japanese chili threads and passion fruit sauce. OMG. That roll is one of the best I've had in my life. (And that's a pretty bold statement-I eat a LOT of sushi.)   And finally we got the Yellowtail Jalapeno Roll. It was pretty darn good, but the first two dishes stole the show.   Our cocktails were excellent made. I had a Grey Goose martini, slightly dirty and my friend got a Kamikaze on the rocks. Perfect!   All in all, I can't wait to go back here! I do want to try the Billionaire Roll, but I didn't want to plunk down $50 for a roll without trying their other dishes first. But I now know that is the next thing I will be trying!!

Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy crab sushi roll and rainbow ceviche.
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rainbow Ceviche-staff favorite and SO delicious!

dfLu1nwca9jO62XxC2R8CQ.text: This place is awesome. I love going ! Atmosphere is great and when something isn't right they correct it. Food is great and they have great happy hours and brunches. Love it. GO!

PjurgbE4KcpV6pZpyCSpSw.text: First timer at this facility, it's also my birthday. The service has been so bad. We had a table in the bar area but felt too crammed so moved to the bar. That's when service got bad. We have to constantly flag employees down to receive any service. No one checks on you. Being this is a unlimited "brunch" it's somewhat pointless bc no one asks if your good or would like anything else. No one is I'll refill your water or mimosa. Very disappointed in this establishment.

-O075s84jTCMSCgPJIALJw.text: I thought I could count on my Yelp friends to steer me to a great restaurant but y"all got it wrong about SumoMaya. Menu is confusing, overpriced, and simply not all that. I didn't have anything awful, but the reviews led me to believe I was going to find my new favorite restaurant. Where was the fusion? Waitress was weird and asked if my daughter eats??? She's 7, no she's on an IV, what kind of question is that? It was loud, and not worth $9 for 2 street tacos.  Guacamole was good but needed salt. I won't be back.

cGLqjYxM-14yrwzFW8FXXQ.text: One of my favorite spots in Scottsdale.  Excellent vibe.  Great music.  Good food.  Love the spot.  Will always be my go to spot on Friday and Saturday

fvwawHnJlVXDWd-WHo_4Bw.text: Phenomenal spot with great food!! They had a DJ until around 11PM, so be careful as it may be loud.  You have to try the Sea Bass, it was cooked perfectly.  The Chili Crab Noodles was probably my favorite dish.  This place is an absolute must try when you're in the area.  Service was good and I like that they had huge TVs where I could watch ESPN.

fjJpwlj7gCARGaIMix_roQ.text: Love, love this restaurant!  The service is super, and the chef has really hit the mark on creating Asian/Mexican Fusion dishes!  The flavors are amazing!

AiRBFkGhCQXUWb5UYPWW_w.text: Came here on a Monday night for HH - we were seated right away & all the staff were very friendly! Sat down & ordered an appetizer & some tea. Their jasmine tea is some of the best I've ever had! We ordered edamame, salmon nigiri, tacos, gyozas & sushi rolls (all pictured). The food was good (nothing to rave over) except the edamame - which was delicious! The sushi roll I think called Suzuki roll (has the dried rice on the outside of the roll) I personally did not enjoy the crunchy texture with each bite (and I usually like tempura rolls but this one was very different). I would not order it again.   I really enjoyed how all of the food was plated - I thought they were presented beautifully! The reason for a 4 star was because the food was okay and the restrooms were dirty & one of the women's stalls was out of toilet paper. Please do better at having someone check these out.

Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork gyoza - hard to mess these up. They were good.
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon Nigiri - tastes like nigiri.

bffosSuHfjeJuG_TcB8V1Q.text: Loved this place. Came here for brunch. Its a very hip Mexican/ Asian fusion spot. They feature outside private patio seating for your small party events. There is traditional seating inside, by the sushi bar and where the main chefs cook.  My party and I ordered the kim chi fried rice, pork al pastor pad thai, carne asada scramble, foie gras & eel roll, rainbow roll liquid cheesecake and bunuelos. We loved the kim chi friend rice, foie gras roll and the pad thai. The combination of Mexican and Asian flavors was delicious. They do feature this Billionaire roll with gold flake and wagyu.   Food and service here was great. This place got really packed right after 11 AM. They feature a very creative menu that is very innovative. I'll definitely be back for dinner to try their other dishes. If your here visiting like myself this is a must go restaurant.

qC87Gff_uEBG_JnEMizFfg.text: We love this place! Great atmosphere & good food! We got the pork belly sushi roll  it was amazing!

oso5C4gQuj8wPsdxbdY2sg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in all of Arizona. Living in New York City I'm surrounded by some of the best restaurants in the country, but I always look forward to coming to AZ to eat at Sumo. The food is perfect and the vibes are perfect.   Every time I go I always request Nina take care of us, her energy and knowledge of the cuisine always makes me and my friends have an amazing time. In terms of good food with a lively atmosphere, this is it. Request Nina, and you'll be taken care of.

o3WHQu3rnAAuuroNzj-_fw.text: Wow. Simply wow. 1) this place is popular and rockin' so take advantage of making reservations. 2) Tuna Tostada: awesome. SEA BASS: borderline spiritual. Rock Shrimp appetizer: great. SEA BASS: celebration in your mouth. Mexican Street Corn: flavorful. SEA BASS: extraordinary. Vietnamese Shaking Beef: mouth watering. SEA BASS: more than memorable. Ceviche: fresh and light. Did I mention the SEA BASS? Tres Leche dessert: wow. 3) service was great. The waitress was very helpful guiding us through the menu.

ulGkqebESdhV6US_cdd5MA.text: I had a much better experience for brunch then I did the first time I went to SumoMaya. Really great set up $30 a person plus $10 for bottomless drinks. Come hungry! Portions are still small for the entrees but the sides and apps make up for it. I loved the blood orange mimosa and the pomegranate guacamole!! Great improvements- music wasn't too loud this time, great service!!

pBP32UrkBi7DiL8PkHolZQ.text: Outstanding! Happy hour menu has a great selection and food was really good. We ordered sushi, tacos, bacon wrapped fig (really good) and other happy hour menu items. I'd go back for sure!

3qMo2itvyh8lb3mybdLqPQ.text: Came in for a late dinner and as always super impressed. We asked for an order of 8 wagyu sushi (I forget the name of the style) and they delivered a piece of art. I'm a picky eater and love their clean and real California rolls. It has literally made me a picky eater since their crab meat they put is real. Also their drinks, tinga tacos, and guacamole are always phenomenal. This place is forever my recommendation to someone out of town.

DxR_zDfjdFMb2EpW-_rdqQ.text: I will keep it short , already many reviews and I don't feel I need to go too much into details.  It was just ok.  Very noisy , food way  too sweet !! everything we ordered ( and we did order expensive food like lobster and tuna) were on the sweet side. Overwhelming for us.  Will not come back! But I am just one opinion ....

DTzV8n0tS5uxsv-X1oHYPQ.text: This place is AMAZING!! Great variety of food and wonderful service!! I highly recommend SumoMaya for brunch! Erica was an excellent server so when you go sit in her section! I can't wait to come back!

tvozg3H1Od2Z1kToqHno5w.text: 2nd time here.  Like bringing guests here and trying explain Mexican Asian fusion.  Also like the big tree growing from the ground on the inside of the restaurant.  Busy buzz interior with a hip and trendy feel. Tapas style and yet they also have big entrees.  I always order way too much every time.  Started woth coconut curry soup which is phenomenal and definitely has a kick to it.  Guacamole with pomegranite is fantastic. The bacon wrapped dates were a little too sweet instead of sweet and salty I think because the dates were too big and dominated.  The fried plantains were also very sweet and we probably shouldn't have ordered them as they didn't go with the meal but my girlfriend likes them.  Pad Thai was a miss so skip that but the foie gras and unagi roll was to die for.  Just melts in your mouth!  Kinchee fried rice is so good and that's coming from a Korean!  We ordered more rolls and all were good.  The dessert sampler for 40$ is a must. Beautiful presentation and delicious flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum!
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped dates and guacamole woth pomegranite seeds
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Good gras unagi roll melts in your mouth. Red dragon roll next to it.

VYzUwwX4rkC92CL3a9BZSw.text: Amazing.   The best Sushi, followed by the best Pad Thai, and the service was incredible.  We didn't have reservations(which is not advisable because this place is packed) but the hostess seated us under the caveat that we had to be finished before the next reservation arrived.  Really outstanding from start to finish

_74FGCBUtSJXksjxbCwQEA.text: I went once. I'll never go back. The food is overpriced. The tacos were cooked well. The severs. Nevermind, I'll just stop there.

OJPr6veJJJDCLA-4N0zOtg.text: OK, just smack me in the back of the head.  I thought a Mexican/Asian tapas restaurant was going to be a bunch of overpriced small plates that leave me stopping for a burger after dinner.  I also was not expecting the ambiance--the place is pretty electric, a mass of staff activity with great warmth and attention to detail, vibrant conversation, music and visual appeal. But the food:  As a group of 4, we just started ordering a few dishes and kept going until we decided it was time to stop.  Not too little, and certainly not a bunch of leftovers.  With this type of meal, everyone is guaranteed to get what they want.  The guacamole, in about 5 different flavours are amazing. The rock shrimp was a table favourite.  Even when we got to desert, I asked them to add the salted caramel ice cream from one desert to another, the rice pudding.  That was an amazing pairing, and I suspect it will make it on the menu.  At the end, we were definitely full, and the bill with libations came out to a pleasing $50 a head.  It's a win!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4lG24moH-9Ao8AyPLatlbg.text: This is an amazing restaurant. The ambiance is spacious, full of light and windows, and organic with a mature tree in the middle. The chef knows what he is doing and you can feel comfortable ordering a random assortment of tapas-style dishes, knowing they will all be interesting, flavorful, and uniquely paired. We especially liked the Chinese sausage and pineapple rice. The mixed drinks are also good. It's definitely a hip vibe with the music a bit on the loud side but the food more than makes up for it. Perfect for a celebratory evening with friends!

0s3aRcEXk2EtucbYCJiD-g.text: Great little spot. First time here, sat at the bar. Great service and good food. Very neat with the tree in the middle of the restaurant. Will definitely return

mwPx-3Q7SvTtdswsvdDMgA.text: Wow. What a great restaurant. The music was loud at first but so cool. Food was outstanding and delicious.  Server was so kind to explain a difficult menu

5duvhfbmt_iheAPl_wqf5Q.text: I decided to come into sumo maya for my 25th birthday to enjoy their bottomless brunch because they have a smoking deal for it. The only reason this review is getting more than zero stars is because the food is quality and our waiters tried their best to make it a good experience..but a little too late after the experience went sour.  I made a reservation a week in advance for 12:30 in the afternoon for 16 people. The hostess said that it wouldn't be a problem as long as we were okay with the patio. I explained that I wasn't too keen on sitting on a patio in 115 degree weather in Arizona in the dead of summer. Her response was "it's a covered patio with fans and misters, and it's pretty cool since it's all enclosed". So I agreed since she convinced me.   We arrive at 12:25. We were told that the people sitting at our table were paying out and that we would be sitting down shortly. At 12:40 we asked how much longer since we now had 16 people blocking the entry way. They said "they're setting your table now". I had my friend ask again at 12:50, and we were told the manager was trying to get the people that sat before us at our table to get up so they can reset...weren't we just told it was being reset? Finally the GM came over to apologize now that we are standing in the doorway for 30 minutes after we had a reservation! The hostess' should have planned their floor better.   When we finally sit down, it is STAGNANT. No breeze, misters are blowing the other direction of the restaurant, and now while we're supposed to be celebrating my birthday, everyone is nauseous and irritated from the heat. They were either understaffed or still don't have this whole "bottomless brunch" down yet. For 16 people, they were bringing out 2 dishes at a time. We each had 2 bites every 15 minutes and we were starving. I finally pulled the waiter aside and said we need to speed up this process and we need our entree order taken. He was clearly very busy and couldn't refill our bottomless mimosas in time, nor take our order in a timely matter. I had 4 mimosas in a 4 hour time frame when it was supposed to be "bottomless". Towards the end, we were so hot we didn't even ask anyone and just sat down inside at a random table. So much for it being a "cool" environment.   Overall, the restaurant was extremely unprepared for a busy brunch rush on a Sunday which is unacceptable being in Scottsdale, and given the clientele that they bring in. Not once were we offered any compensation for the inconvenience or the lack of service we were being given. It was just apology after apology. We definitely will not come back if it's more than 2 people, if we come back at all. They have a lot of work to do.

Qn7xlegoYPYMrHJeoIRr7Q.text: To preface, we sat at the bar during happy hour. The experience started out well-- the bartenders were attentive and helpful. As the crowd poured in the two bartenders were far too few to accommodate the demand. Multiple attempts to order food were dismissed.  I ordered the spicy crab noodles which came with one very small piece of crab atop.  The bar tender immediately agreed this was too little. Apparently the kitchen wasn't impressed and did nothing despite me speaking up. After waiting another 20 minutes to order dessert or more food, we asked for our check and left ASAP. Cool atmosphere but would not go back.

xGE8q1VmXhT82JCIEmVssg.text: A trendy restaurant with a hip vibe,  and good food, cocktails and service and with an amazing happy hour menu! Mexican Asian fusion food at its finest! What we had ~ guacamole, grilled shishito peppers with bonito flakes, crispy rock shrimp, crispy calamari, rainbow ceviche (large portion of freshly made tuna, salmon and hamachi in a slightly citrusy jalapeno vinagrette and by far my favorite dish), filet mignon saking beef (so tender and cooked to perfection)! Bartenders were friendly, well versed in the menu and extremely attentive! This will definitely be our  go to place whenever we visit Scottsdale!

3GlI-5hZS-ePkocIlGiBQA.text: The food is carefully prepared. Delicious.  Quality over quantity.  I don't like their blend of coffee :( bummer.  They don't have heavy cream in the back for my coffee either.

PLemrmoBcSNlI4YJ4LQTjw.text: In fairness I never tried the food. This is what I know... we ordered drinks they came 20 minutes later on a Tuesday night. It was so loud we couldn't hear each other. Parking was only valet which frustrated me. Wait was 1 hour 45 Minutes.   Now we are in our 40's but perhaps if I was on my 20's or 30's and "hip" I would want to be seen here.   I'm more like... I want good food, great drinks and an environment I can hear my husband speak.   So take my review in context of what it is.... I wanted to try the food but my patience and how loud overtook my desire to eat here. Will not return.

p5vOBezfek3g0fbsBLyG9g.text: Came for Saturday brunch special... 1st course probably better than 2nd since you can have sushi...granola was great and so were black beans and rice... only change I would make is not to have pineapple in rice which is bit like pineapple pizza (either you hate it or hate it)... 2nd course smoked salmon omelette was nice minus the sauce which does not add anything to dish other than calories...had early grey tea but they brought lemon with that which meant nobody else orders it... lemon are great with herbal teas and black teas usually have milk or creams like coffee..place was busy and they had live music playing ... which is nice but was too loud to talk with anyone on your table...and after the first course came had to wait for milk and cutlery to be brought out... looks like they did not setup tables after first group leaves... cold tea is usually not good.. 3 stars for food and minus 2 for service or lack there of.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Too much empty calories on top
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Early grey served with lemon instead of milk
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Live music

3Q16ktQPTHVqj4ebUtsvSA.text: I love the Whimsy Modern Airy Atmosphere. When you walk in and you get the feeling you are one of those beautiful people in a movie that's in a really cool place somewhere. Oh But Yes you are it's Scottsdale AZ !  Asian and Latin Faces are sprinkled on some of the seats and a big really Real Looking tree is planted in the dining room. The Beautiful Restaurant was also pristine clean like a hospital.  Our waiter was very welcoming and explained the menu to us. The food is Asian Mexican Fusion and is TAPAS Style meaning you share small plates and do need to order 2 - 3 plates a person even at lunch time.  We started with the Korean Beef Tacos and the Miso Eggplant. Both were delicious and oh so delicate I think someone must have very good eye sight and used tweezers to add all the tiny delicate flowers and micro veggies in the right places on both these dishes. The Eggplant is a must get dish, it's creamy eggplant flesh that's slightly sweet and laced with miso and sake and also  adorned with sesame seeds. I would say the same about the Tacos  that are just as delicate and are also highly detailed and ARE DELICIOUS. But I do think they should up the price a few dollars and give you more tacos because my photo doesn't show you how small they really are. They are smaller than street tacos and you only get two to share. They were delicious and delicate but they were only a very small taste as they are only two bites at the most.  We also shared the Crispy Chicken Mole, another must get dish. Like everything else the presentation of the food was EXQUISITE! The dish was made with really moist delicious Chicken and Sweet Plantains and pickled red onions to cut the richness of the mole. It wasn't big on crisp but was really oh so delicious and I sure wouldn't mind getting it again.  For lunch this was more of a splurge but this is the kind of place when you want something special and different. I thought dinner prices were reasonable as they didn't differ so much from lunch.  I don't know if everything on the menu is as delicious as what I tried but sure will come back again to find out!  The only thing holding me back from giving 5 stars are the tacos as interesting and delicious as they were. They were smaller than street tacos and you only got two for $7.00. For me I think either the tacos should become slightly bigger or they should up the price a few dollars and give you four tacos to share.  I note everything else I tried seemed in line with what it should cost.  Service was very welcoming and very efficient.   I can't wait to try this place out for dinner!  4.5 Stars

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Korean Beef Taco (close up)
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crispy Chicken Mole
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Korean Beef Tacos and the Miso Eggplant

2d1gCKWI1KZgF59vqjHx6A.text: Came in with the parents and fiance for a pleasant surprise! The mexi asian fusion sushi was Bomb.com. I highly recommend the maya roll and spicy tuna tacos. Everything was so fresh and came out pretty quickly. Great for sharing and people watching. Dress to impress :)

IbIeH8Dq3EkV8K4dVRhfYA.text: I really wanted to like this place because of all the raving reviews. I came here on a Thursday evening for happy hour. The bar area was pretty busy and we found seats at the hi-top table. We ordered the crab guacamole, sushi rolls, shishito peppers, and the bacon wrapped dates. The only dish I would come back for is the guac.... But for the price I'd rather go elsewhere. The sushi was okay buy nothing to come back for.  Would I come back here you ask?? Sorry, sumo you wouldn't be my first choice.

5cb7EgjXVMORXr8kH0cQEA.text: The male bartenders are friendly and attentive. They remember us eavj time we return. Happy hour is awesome! Good vegetarian options too, although Im concerned they cheapened a few thinga now that they're not offering the wild mushroom tacos and puttimg them in the kimchee dish anylonger.

prOILJ_XmhdEa9BRLKuH1g.text: I am currently sitting at the bar of this lovely new restaurant and am happy to say that my butt is the first one to have officially sat here! Huzzah! This place has a few kinks to work out, as it is opening day, first seating, but it has some serious potential. The managers/ owners graciously allowed me to try a few of their cocktails on the house and all were tasty. The clear standout is the frozen coconut mojito! Extremely delicious. I also had the coconut drink, which was very pure in coconut flavor and the passionfruit drink (10$ normal price, 8$ hh) which was gingery and smokey and overall unlike anything i have had before. Plus this place has hard a on tap... Cool stuff. For food we Trued the following:  dates wrapped in bacon - very tasty... How could it not be? It's a date with cheese and chorizo inside and wrapped in bacon on top of a foie gras sauce.... Come on!  chicken tacos- very flavorful but tiny... I would like more for sure!  traditional guac- flavorful and plentiful, but served with weird tostada type chips... Good tasting and clearly house made, but awkward to eat.  pollo chcharrones- so yummy with the  miso mustard... Nicely done!  this place is a definite return to place, reasonable prices, good drinks, nice hh, and interesting food (not to mention cute decor).   check it out yelpers!  ps, first!!

Ed0XKneTvuvCLgvQH28LUw.text: The mango habanero sauce/salsa thing is #bombdotcom. A hint of sweetness at first with a huge lingering kick. A very balanced combination of both. Food was a good mix of interesting and different flavors. The size is smaller (almost like tapas) so it is easier to try numerous menu items. Pricing is moderate. A bit pricy for some items but def nothing outrageous.    The staff was friendly and attentive, though that may be because we arrived shortly after they opened for the day. Didn't have to contend with too many other customers at the time which was a huge bonus.  Seeing as the restaurant is new, there were a few execution issues I noticed with our meal. The sea bass was overly seasoned and I kept looking for something to help cut the saltiness. The garnishes on the plate didn't help much in that respect. The overall flavor and concept of the dish was nice though. Def would try again.Their sushi was beautifully presented but wasn't rolled (or packed, since the pieces were square) very tightly. It often fell apart as we tried to pick them up. Aside for these couple of items, it was a nice experience.  HH daily so I'll def be back.

VErOhZfKl8I7l7df58FBZQ.text: Very eclectic menu.......Asian, Mexican with a very interesting twist.....we had a few small plates so we can try all of the difference tastes......fish tacos were very good.....atmosphere was very good.....we enjoyed it very much.....the one knock was the Korean beef was a bit tough.....
