6nbynpVYHP0HOXQ5VXTc3Q.text: Was extremely underwhelmed by the food. Tried majority of the menu for the bottomless brunch. The apps provided unlimited were not that great, mediocre. We ordered nothing twice. Majority of our dishes were extremely spicy, without indicating on the menu. Was caught off guard and wasn't enjoyable. Even the churro waffle that came with chocolate ice cream was spicy, tons of cinnamon in the chocolate ice cream that's not indicated on the menu. Spicy is great but better when indicated on the menu. Decor and interior is very cute and trendy. But food was not good. I will not return :(

sf-AmZ6R_uLRPQIo_oy-yQ.text: Very trendy hipster type place in Scottsdale. Hate the too cool for school atmosphere but the food will make you forget. Absolutely fantastic - calabacitas guacamole. Spicy crab noodles. Arroz verde and don't forget the sushi. 5 stars are for the food. The snotty wait staff get 2 stars.

ZOzjQhJVjV-rZ3XtbH-RRg.text: My party of 17 had a blast at this restaurant for my sisters bachelorette party. At first i was skeptical of Asian and Mexican cuisines combined and if it would taste good. Boy, was I wrong. Every bite was more and more delicious. We had an incredible customized menu because the guest of honor is gluten free. I wish i lived in Arizona because i would definitely go again. Wait staff was awesome as well.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5eZJbqMBuOZ-utVt58LD6g.text: Absolutely loved SumoMaya! The food was delicious, our server was amazing,  and I really appreciated the live dj. I even asked if I could get a hold of his set list haha. I ordered the rainbow ceviche and the tuna roll. Both were fresh and flavorful. The drinks were also top notch, beautifully presented and overall wonderful cocktails. We had told the staff that we were celebrating a bachelorette and the staff brought out a dessert with a sparkler to celebrate! They truly went above and beyond and I can't say enough good things about this restaurant.

6-rHFbWLVOfn0qs-oz7F-g.text: We went to Sumomaya as a group of 4 on Jan 30.  3 of 4 of our group got food poisoning so bad that we had to write off Thur and Fri of our week long vacation.  Food was innovative and interesting but we got so sick that I can't recommend this place.

hmSyLP5XVKO1KoHIVjxs6Q.text: Came in for a late lunch on a weekday so it was not extremely busy. Got seated right away and was able to munch on many of their delish appetizers! The service was great - our waitress was extremely helpful and was able to answer our questions about the menu quickly. Lots of amazing dishes on the menu which incorporate the Asian-Mexican fusion very well. I've heard about their brunch and can't wait to come back and try it!

6j4nRPoqFgi5A74rrGpL6Q.text: What an interesting place. First just the decor very modern asiany zen style with the giant tree near the bar, the funky chairs with heads printed on the backseat.  We didn't make a reservation so we ended sitting at the bar which was totally fine, comfy seats and great bar table length.  The food itself was pretty good! The fusion Mexican Asian was pretty interesting but I thought everything went well together. This place is tapas style so we got to order a bunch of dishes. On top of my head I remember the ceviche, the guac, the tacos and the kimchi fried rice.  It's definitely a fun place to have drinks and food. If you are not in the "party" mood I would go some place else because the music and the place itself gets pretty loud. It was a bit challenging to have a conversation.

Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roll
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guac with yummy chips

ercrmp6zHvqbsbwOblqleA.text: Probably one of my favorite restaurant to go in scottsdale. Suit perfect for every events. Such a cool place to celebrate birthday , they have fun things for birthday , shots and fireworks in the middle of it , delicious dessert with fireworks .  The atmosphere of restaurant is just so unique and different , It's a beautiful place for a date. They have such a romantic place under real trees which make it so special. They take a reservation, so if you are gonna make a reservation be sure you asked for a table that he under trees.   This Saturday when I was there they had a wonderful band there. I would've just pay to go and see that band.  I love this restaurant because it gives you both choices if you wanna eat sushi you can if you wanna have Mexican food you can. I love the idea that you can see the kitchen in front of you .   Their unlimited brunch is a bomb. For only $29 per person .Perfect thing to do as a group or a date. You can have unlimited delicious appetizer + 1 choice of entree + unlimited sides + unlimited dessert, in top of that your call to have unlimited mimosas, margarita , Bloody Mary .  On top of delicious drink and food what makes me to be sure to get back there was our waiter,Alec . He was not neglected us and while he was so busy there he still serves us wonderful way.   Oh and of course they have a complimentary Valet that makes everything so much better.  Can't wait to get back there. Definitely suggested to go there if you wanna try something unique , fancy and nice .

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. If you are going there be sure you asked for Alec to serve you

uRunIZjcGDUfEeryzJ4GLA.text: Bottomless brunch. Enough said. $29 for unlimited food, $10 for all you can drink Bloody Mary, Mimosa (Orange juice or Prickly Pear) and a couple other option. $.01 for every drink.  Bloody Mary was delicious with a slight spicy kick to it! Served with an olive and lemon. Our waitress did a great job of making sure no one had an empty drink.  Our table's favorites.  Step 1: -Pomegrante Guacamole  -Sushi roll  Step 2: -pad Thai -poke bowl -fried chicken sandwich  Dessert was delicious. Don't let liquid cheesecake deter you. It's more like a custard. Tip: dip the fried dough dessert in the cheesecake. It's a delicious pairing!  Service was exceptional!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork Al Pastor Pad Thai
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Poke Bowl

PkduO9huc7mHYsA7dyLlWw.text: I've given this place several chances as I really wanted to like it. The times I've been in are always around midday and I sit at the bar. Every time, the dishes have been quite obviously dirty, chunks of dried on old food.  The food, I would say is just okay, guacamole is good. I would stay away from the sushi, color didn't seem right on my tuna roll, and texture was off....and that is usually a steady dish for me.  Each time I was there, they were having an issue with the beer tappers so it would take 15 min of foam dumping before I could get a cool-ish (not cold) beer. Service is hit or miss, takes a relatively long time to get acknowledged at the bar even when it isn't busy.  I'm giving Sumo Maya an overall thumbs down. Cool concept, but just too many little things that are wrong. Much higher quality places to eat and drink nearby, I would recommend going to one of those.

GBFschCBCjvmqWYVGF3ieA.text: When we were seated, we asked, "are you celebrating a special occasion today?" Although a work conference may not be a typical "special occasion," SumoMayo made us feel like we were celebrating something spectacular. THIS is the place you go for such occasions.   The restaurant is simply beautiful. Perhaps you may feel like you're sitting on a plaza in Mexico City. Big Night time, for sure! We sat in front of a tree, with a view of the open kitchen. I don't always love having a view of an open kitchen, but it felt totally fine here, almost a natural extension of the dining area.  I had been up for a zillion hours, so although the cocktail list beckoned with such delightful concoctions as a Hibiscus Mezcalrita, I stuck to a glass of wine. There are plenty of options to wet your whistle and it's your celebration, remember!  Let's chat about the vegan options, shall we? Note that the menu indicates vegetarian items, but not vegan. Just ask your server. On that note, a place of improvement would definitely be to educate servers on which items can be made dairy/egg-free.  Time to gush on that pomegranate guacamole before anything else. Unreal. I could have had a platter of it, quite honestly. If I lived in the area, I would come back here and ask if they could make guac tacos for me. I loved the tart slightly sweet pom seeds complimenting the richness of the guac. This was my absolute favorite thing in a meal of many tasty things.  My dining companions agreed that eggplant can sometimes be iffy (but then put in orders for two on the recommendation of yelpers.) When it's good, it's sublime, but it can often be so so tragically wrong. You know what I mean. Here, it's sweet with a miso glaze. I'll admit it wasn't perfection (a bit too chewy for my liking) but the flavor is excellent.   Not as exciting to write about, but the mixed greens with ginger dressing is fresh and tasty. The perfect healthy compliment if you're going to town on stuff like chips and guac!  The visually appealing Arroz Verde is just as delicious as it looks. I might have eaten it down to the final grain of rice! I loved the texture fiesta- perfectly cooked and seasoned rice, mushrooms and edamame. This is a light dish as well, and thoroughly satisfying.  Note that most of your vegan options would be the rice dishes and if you just go by the menu, a basic sushi roll. But! There's a secret veggie roll that you won't find on there, thanks to our fabulous waitress' tip. It's a crunchy AAC (possibly with pickle as well) and is topped with thinly sliced avocado. Outstanding!   Our group thoroughly enjoyed our time here. I'd gladly go back when  I'm in town for pom guac (two orders, ahem), the arroz verde and secret vegan roll. SumoMaya can always make you feel like you're on vacation or celebrating a big win!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Secret vegan roll
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Arroz Verde

Ne2hLNpn0AxSn-mR-1qjIA.text: Bottomless brunch was ok.  There to celebrate a birthday party so it worked out well as far as portion sizes, once the other three members of our party arrived.  Initially there were three of us there so we kept having to ask for appetizers rather than them just being brought out like when the party became 6.  Now im writing this to ask a redundant question, because there were several other parties of white women present for longer than a 2 hr allotment. Are parties/tables asked to leave after they have been in the establishment for two hours? Bc after our table full of women of color, paid for our bill, abt 10 mins later we were asked to leave. Not by a manager but by our waitress. And it wasnt like a "hey youve been here for two hrs" instead a "my manager asked that you leave, we have other reservations, etc." Ok, and? This was extremely rude after we had just spent $300 in this establishment and there were plenty of other tables for reservations or parties to sit.  Ive been here a few times and always feel unwelcome, so i wont be back. I gave two stars for Ashley and Huevos rancheros.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

iIiLCFtiOodgud0oABDyuw.text: Oh my goodness, I wrote a review back in 2016 so it definitely needs an update!  I literally had not been here since 2016 and boy have I been missing out! I absolutely LOVE their food! It is the perfect combination of Asian + Mexican fusion! What a concept, right? I came for lunch this time and was in absolute foodie heaven!   We split their shrimp ceviche and calabacitas guacamole - both dishes were exploding with flavor and so dang  dreamy. For my entree, I ordered their Pad Thai with al pastor pork (yes, you heard me right!) and it was honestly one of the best things that i've eaten out in a LONG time. Like I will be craving this for weeks to come!  I love the colorful, hip atmosphere, unique cocktails and entrees, and overall, it is a MUST when in Scottsdale. I can't wait to come back again soon! It would be a great celebration spot, too!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork Al Pastor Pad Thai - the best I&#39;ve ever had!!!
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Calabacitas Guacamole - THE BEST

yluY75NsKDvoD_poQ0Jtlw.text: Experienced SumoMaya on a work trip last week and WOW. The ambiance, the food, and the service were all absolutely too notch. We ordered some starters to share and then some individual entrees. This is definitely a spot conducive to sharing, and I highly recommend trying as much as you can on your visit (absolutely everything was delish)!  The miso eggplant was the star of the evening, in my opinion. This is an absolute must-order and one of the best Asian style vegetables I have ever had. Still day dreaming about it a week later. I didn't order any sushi myself and had major FOMO once some other attendees had theirs brought out. I went with the fish tacos and Mexican street corn - which is served with popcorn on top and doused in a cream/butter sauce (not great for your waistline but holy COW).   Prices were super reasonable and I cannot wait to eat that miso eggplant again the next time I'm in AZ. The cocktail list is also expansive, so be sure to imbibe with your tapas/meal. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mule
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Miso Eggplant
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mexican Street Corn

1lwufLOPXwQpimM_n1pYPg.text: Such a great restaurant. Super nice decor and love the atmosphere. They were playing house music at about 10pm and they close pretty late which is a plus. We got bacon wrapped dates, traditional guacamole, beef chimichuri (spelling?) and sea bass. It was so amazing. Every part of our meal.   We also got cocktails: the triangle and passion fruit pisco sour. Definitely going to come back again when I'm in Scottsdale.   Our service was excellent as well. Thank you Nicole for all the amazing recommendations. You're the best!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZE0b9tvUnrqnnma3GckkyQ.text: Reservations are a must, on any day of the week. I frequent this spot. But recently have gone on a few dates here, it gets a little loud and a little too dim. But got damn the food is good. Brunch is a must!

zzS6xeKFyOPMGGe9Jw__NA.text: The ambiance here is fantastic. The vibes are amazing, the open concept kitchen gives for a very lively feel. This place is fusion, and it doesn't really work. I loved the Mexican dishes and hated/didn't care for the Asian dishes. I had such high hopes for this place coming to scottsdale, and I was most disappointed by this restaurant overall.   The chicken wings were good - spicy!  The pomegranate guacamole was also delicious. The grilled street corn was terrible.... i hated it. The Peruvian corn was ever worse - it's giant corn soup! The al pastor tacos were good, as were the kimchi tacos.  The pad Thai was nothing special, and the fried rice was even less special.  These Asian dishes did not wow me at all. It honestly kind of just tasted like takeout. Sad face.  If I came back, I'd come back for the lychee martini, the chicken wings and the guacamole. Otherwise, I didn't really care for the rest of what we ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pomegranate Guacamole - 5 stars
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried rice - ehhh
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mexican Street Corn - not good IMO

ej-qf74x3l9tw5ZG_mxVJg.text: Love this place - I am a regular and had a negative experience here but the manager Celia went out of her way to acknowledge it and made it right 100% with me last week. I really appreciate when a business can take a negative criticism and goes the extra mile to turn it around. I look forward to more positive and most importantly fun experiences here :)

mFzisTJayi-jGUAHWo29Ww.text: Japanese Mexican? YES! Not only yes, but of course, when you see how they put it together.  Went here as a party of six and we ordered almost everything on the menu. We had multiple cocktails, sushi, guacamole and everything in between.   Others in our group have been there many times and said it can get packed and that they sometimes have dancing late. They didn't have any such thing the night I was there but I can imagine that being a great addition to the great food and cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bathroom art...
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rainbow ceviche

Q2tAZbh83kihELXDUMErJw.text: I'm really torn on what to give SumoMaya for a rating.  I'd heard so much about this place so I decided to check it out before I left town.  I walked into Sunday brunch and sat at the bar.  The good thing about this was they had their endless brunch menu and I definitely got my $29 worth. The bad thing was I really didn't want brunch food and the only other options was some sushi that looked ridiculously overpriced and the same brunch items available a la cart.  So endless brunch it was.  The black bean hummus was delicious.  I don't know if I would call it hummus though. It tasted like pureed black beans and chimichurri.  I didnt get any tahini, olive oil, or really even garlic flavor out it.  Tahini is a must for hummus. And chimichurri usually has garlic.  Let's just call it black bean dip, it was good.  And the accompanying "chips" were delicious. Nothing like fried tortillas on property!  The pomegranate guacamole was ok.  I would have liked more heat and maybe more cilantro.  The addition of pomegranate was a nice touch though.  Once again the chips were on point.  I understand you cant be giving out your best sushi when it's part of an all you can eat but I feel like there was some room for improvement here.  The veggie roll doesn't constitute sushi in my book.  The tuna roll was delicious, the tuna tasted fresh.  The other roll was surprisingly delicious as well.  I would have enjoyed a 4th type of sushi or something subbed in for the "veggie thingy".    For my main entree I chose the Wagyu steak and eegs.  I should have known something was up when I wasn't asked how I wanted my steak cooked.  The steak was skirt steak or flank steak which I don't associate with steak and eggs but I guess it is steak afterall.  The meat was ok but being skirt steak it was difficult to cut it not into jerky like strips.  Now about the eggs...I had to look to make sure the menu says steak and eggs, it does.  There was 1 egg.  This was steak and egg, not eggs.  The egg was cold.  It could have been the temperature of the coconut miso sauce poured over it or it could have just sat in the window too long.  Overall the temperature was a little on the cold side.  Flavor was there but I dont think I would order it again.  Endless brunch comes with a dessert so I opted for the liquid cheesecake and I'm glad I did. Phenomenal! I highly recommend it!  It wasn't too sweet and was the perfect amount.   Service was atrocious! Like most places I visited in Scottsdale service was non-existent.  Keep in mind I was sitting at the bar, by the service well.  Plates sat finished pushed forward in front of me multiple time.  I watched the bartenders walk by multiple times without paying attention.  Managers and other servers waiting for their drinks in front of me and still plates would sit there for 5+ minutes.  I was hardly checked up on.  My water was empty 2 times and bartenders would just walk by.  I understand bartenders get busy, but with the bottomless drinks that were going out for the bottomless brunch, they were all prebatched! With the exception of the bloody Mary which the bloody Mary mix was prebatched, it was still vodka and prebatch.  There's no reason why that service well was that backed up and the bartenders were that oblivious to the customers at the bar.    Overall ambiance was 4 stars.  It was very lively and the decor was beautiful.  Food was 4 stars. Service was honestly 1 star. Value for bottomless brunch was 5 stars.    I'm going to rate SumoMaya 4 stars for now.  I would love to come back at dinnertime and try some of the other items.  If you're on a budget I highly recommend SumoMaya for brunch as it's a great bang for your buck.

We had the Garlic Edamame, the " real " California Roll with real crab, original guacamole and the Tuna Tacos. The service was great and Sumo Maya has such a great atmosphere. btC5sLnqPuMgO3e9khSOdQ.text: This place has it all - great food, amazing service, good music and electric vibe! We had the surf n turf, pork belly roll, and sashimi. It was all delicious - don't forget to make reservations - it's normally a few hours wait. My top  restaurant here in Scottsdale, AZ.

IjSG7VzQNwEjCuMy0e8s5A.text: I went for brunch Saturday morning for my birthday and had such a fun time! We made a reservation for 5 people at 1230pm and were seated on time inside, in a prime spot.  Aaron was our server and was the absolute best! He was attentive, funny and made sure to keep checking in on us. We just the most amazing time thanks to him!! We had mimosas, prickly pear and pomegranate flavored. They were so good and they gave us the flavoring on the side so we could choose to pour however much we wanted in our drink. The sushi and oatmeal were our two fave starters and for the entree the steak and eggs were DELICIOUS. They brought out this liquid cheesecake for dessert with the sparkler on top which was of course fun! And omg the dessert was to die for. I came here a few years ago and didn't have the greatest experience, but I'm glad I came back and gave it another shot! I look forward to coming back for another fun brunch experience :)

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak and Eggs!!

52V1KW_L6bYEle6ROG1V9A.text: Visiting from Chicago for our babymoon and heard a lot of rave reviews about SumoMaya. We decided to give it a try one of the nights we were in and were blown away! I was a little wary at first with the menu, wondering whether I'd be able to eat much that was available, but it was not a problem at all.   We started with the Calabacitas guacamole based on the recommendation from our waitress and we were surprised at how much we loved it! Chunks of squash mixed into the guac kept surprising us - if you're a texture eater like I am, you've got to try this. We both loved it. We ended up splitting the main dishes we ordered because we wanted to try as much as we could - we ordered the Seafood Rice Mariscada (basically paella), Korean Beef tacos, and Al Pastor tacos and loved every single bite. The tacos were difficult to pick which ones were better...just get both if you're on the fence :) We absolutely loved the flavors in the paella, too. Perfect amount of seafood to rice ratio!   We're keeping our fingers crossed that SumoMaya opens a location in Chicago as our server suggested...we will be the first in line to dine if/when it does.

XOocljgzJPm9jGKwNQtvnw.text: During a weekend trip to Scottsdale, we went here based on recommendations from friends.   First, the hostess was extremely friendly. We had just gotten in from the airport, had a couple of hours left before we could check into our AirBnb, and had a huge suitcase with us. The hostess graciously offered to let us leave our suitcase by her register, so that we could eat in peace.  Second, the decor in this place - wow! It is seriously SO cute. I love the chairs (clear, with faces on them) were super creative. The whole design is really modern. Also, I love the fact that there is a huge, random tree in the middle of everything. It's so fun!   Third, the pomegranate guacamole was light and refreshing, and very different. It was cool because I have not had a mixture of flavor like that before; however, if you order this, definitely request limes and maybe a pinch more salt. It would have been perfect if it had more lime and extra salt.   Fourth, the rainbow ceviche was refreshing. The best part of the ceviche was the tuna. Thus, if you are able to request it with JUS the tuna, I would recommend doing that.   Fifth, my FAVORITE, the ELOTE was PHENOMENAL. I am obsessed with elote and this was seriously one of the best I've had.  Sixth, I recommend either the Watermelon Margarita, or the Spicy Peach. Both are delicious.

Eunkz8eTYKxrH0zOeR9GWA.text: The atmosphere of this place is so unique and hip. It sort of reminds me of Vegas, but everything would cost twice as much there! There's a beautiful giant tree inside and although it's not real, it's still breathtaking.   I started with a hibiscus mezcarita. I'm a huge fan of mezcal and tequila mixed together, so anytime I see it on a menu, my eyes gravitate towards it. This one did not disappoint. It came complete with a beautiful purple flower on top. It was as stunning as it was delicious! Highly recommend.   For the meal, we started with a bunch of appetizers. By far, the eggplant was my favorite, which I'm surprised by. I'm Italian, and my family makes eggplant parm probably 5 times a month and I never have it. Maybe it was because I was in a setting with my coworkers and I didn't want to get a little judged for being Italian and NOT like eggplant (can you image the look of shock?). So I went for it. And I'm sure glad I did. It was the best I've ever had (sorry, mom). The flavor was so delicious that they didn't even need to disguise it with a ton of sauce and cheese.  For dinner, instead of opting into my usual go-to tacos, I decided to try the Chinese Sausage and Pineapple bowl. I'm so glad I did. It was incredible! The pineapple was such a great sweet flavor to the dish.   Great spot for sure! Definitely will be back when I come visit again.

rtpvo0JFTKoARijS2yCIIg.text: Was looking forward to trying this new and trendy Asian Fusion Restaurant. My husband and i met a friend there in the early afternoon. The place was not busy, the decor is modern and fun however, the music was so loud you couldn't think. We asked the server three times to turn it down but no luck. The drinks were fair, and took 15 minutes to get to the table. I can't imagine how long it would take if it were busy! The food was tasty, but the taco portion sizes were ridiculous for the money. Half the size of a normal taco and twice the cost. We had 2 small tacos, 1 order of sushi and 1 drink each, totaling $60!  Would not recommend and will not be back. Very surprised at the 4 star reviews. There are plenty of other trendy Scottsdale restaurants that surpass this place. Very very disappointing.

e8kxcrx3z3j6yCEl2eXdzQ.text: Great place for happy hour, large group gatherings, and to enjoy great fusion food. Have loved it every time - all the sushi is delicious. Drinks are also unique and delicious - both alcoholic and non-alcoholic.

uVqnjUvLjMcMEF3r5qxHSw.text: Just a heads up! For brunch the Green Tea waffle & duck is a VERY small portion. Like literally half a waffle & a baby duck wing. Like wtf?? )13-15$? For that meal. Don't get me wrong it was delicious but did not fill me up whatsoever! Like I could of ate another meal after that. && I'm a tiny person, 26 at 5'2 and 106 lbs. I was still starving after that. Ok. Rant over. Lol

sj_n00i-M3_LMUBXY5Luew.text: Excellent  place for food and drinks.  Love the mix and the options available.   Tacos were perfect, guacamole was great and pad Thai  was amazing.  Atmosphere  was energetic,  but not loud. Love the open space and layout.

NrrA6oqar9S-CSSEGeVDsg.text: Went there on a Friday night and have to say top 5 meal of my life.  I got the ahi tuna tacos and Korean beef tacos and they were so amazing.  My wife got the Carne asada and said it was perfectly cooked.  It is a fun environment with great service.  I highly recommend.

f_rmvp8RLBqiUJ_jDw7YoQ.text: Great food. Glad we decided to come here before we left. Had the pork tacos, Korean barbeque tacos, red dragon roll, shishito peppers, and mango salad. Everything was absolutely delicious.

iKVyNeL03d_d_j1Wvbwh9A.text: Went for happy hour great selection of food and drinks. I had the sake sangria it was sooo refreshing.  We also had tacos and the spicy tuna roll. All were sooo good! Would come back if in town again. The only thing is that the cocktails rang up on the wrong price it was quickly fixed but glad we caught the mistake. 4HYd0WTN4VD_asV9tkJVqg.text: Place is awesome. Food is also good. Service sucks and what ever you do look at your bill.   We went there with another couple . My good friends pick up the tab.  After paying we left that night they told us the bill was 345.00.  WTF.   We went over what we ordered cause we had a menu the bill with drinks came to 165.00.      Really 2 lady's 2 men. 7JT0zqau1GW2fi3DemqKvw.text: Great place!!  Last night was the first time for me and I will definitely go back.  Great food, great ambiance, great service, stiff drinks and a lot of good looking people.  Its no wonder why its so hard to get reservations here.

P-YHzDv7iwM46aAkHZcyUA.text: Asian+mexican! Muy rico. We pretty much tried half the menu lol. Portions are small so ordered a few things. My fave was the passionfruit sangria and the chingon roll. The pad thai was good but I think I like the traditional version best. Also really love the tree :)

Iy0swf1OKMeUBTHUsCEVVQ.text: Great food! The arroz con pato was amazing! And the drinks were awesome! First time ever trying bacon concerned dates and I was impressed. The decor is gorgeous and staff is nice. Great place to go with friends on a Friday night!

5NhQJ_WxBhjGpgjo5Ksb_w.text: This place is really quite good ! Scottsdale is not generally the best city for food, but This one is really delicious. I've not tried one bad dish yet. It's very consistent! It's also kind of nice that the portions are small ! It's just perfect for people that are looking to enjoy a classy setting with some gourmet food that isn't going to make you regret your caloric intake! The owner has 2-3 more restaurants in the valley (different types of cuisines) and every restaurant he is involved in is delicious !!! I guess it pays off to live and study in Europe :) .

3yXrXG_Zw4QgjXgf0J05fg.text: The anticipation of going to SumoMaya was big but so was the disappointment.  My friends and I thought we would try it for the first time and we went on a Sunday during happy hour.  The food was good but nothing amazing but the most disappointing part of the experience was the service.  It was as if the waitress was going through training or should go through training.  She took a long time to come back every time we ordered something and our drinks sat at the bar for 10 min before I asked another server to bring them to us.  Every part of the mail was disjointed.  I think there was a manager on duty but all she did was walk around and talk to the bartenders it did not seem she has any idea of what was going on.  I think it would be a good idea for leadership to review their systems and staff and determine how they could be more efficient.  I wish them the best but until these systems are in place I will not be going back.   Sincerely  Very disappointed customer

7cIi2H3Kr4ls2EWsDmB56A.text: Had my first lunch here today and it was wonderful.  From the friendly hostess and the efficient waitress, to the delicious lunch, it could not have gone better.  I loved the pork al pastor pad thai, and also got a taste of the tamarind shrimp.  Both were excellent, and the temperature was perfect.  The other three people at my table also thoroughly enjoyed their lunch, and none of them had been here either.  The only thing I would change was the loud music at lunch which made it a little more difficult to have a business meeting.  Nobody else complained about the volume, so it may just be me.  It sucks getting old.  It's certainly not for sissies.

m1nUWtYMZOqIKBzzGfgSdg.text: I was a little hesitant to try out this restaurants with the whole Asian-Mexican fusion thing. I'm glad I did. I've been here several times and will be back. They have one of the best Kimchi friend rice and Ramen in Phx. I'm from LA (lots of Korean restaurant) and been to Japan to compare. A must try if you are a foodie!

em4mPLS7ARS1Qx2ZtKCv8g.text: Sumo maya has the most amazing Brunch ever Jordyn was the best server we could have ever asked for. I am very picky with my food options and she made sure that my meals were up to par and out drinks were never empty. Her attitude made our experience unforgettable! We will definitely be back and request Jordyn every time!

HBA8Pv_RzXV_lprzqX_MMA.text: SumoMaya combines a party atmosphere, a bar, and a sit down restaurant all into one. For those looking for somewhere hip to drink and/or eat, you've definitely come to the right place!  We ordered enough food quite possibly for a small army, including 2 types of guacamole, sushi rolls, ceviche, kimchee fried rice, various tacos, and chile-crab garlic noodles. The sushi roll we had (Shishito roll) was just average. The slight bitter flavor of the shishito pepper, which can be a delectable taste for the senses when roasted, didn't quite mesh with the sweetness of the kiwi + mango-habanero sauce for me. Other fusion items we had were tantalizing though. Some notable dishes were the Singapore crab noodles and the al pastor tacos. The strong flavors of the meat with seasoning contrasted well with the starch component in each dish.  For dessert, they have various options such as cheesecake, mochi, and chocolate cake.   Service was decent for a bustling and busy weekend night. One of the co-owners came by to check up on us and see how we were enjoying things, a nice touch!  Since this is such a vibrant atmosphere, it's not quite the place you'd want to take someone for an intimate evening where you can engage in deep conversation, especially when Kris Kross's "Jump" is playing on the loudspeakers (Admit it- you know you'd want to jump along with the music!). :)

JKXlr1RGiRHVcFfhcrVoRw.text: **large party** we ordered 25 shots of tequila ($250) they gave us 14 shots of pure water, when we asked for the manager Mike he accused us of filling up our shot glasses with water, I was extremely offended. After 15 minutes of communicating with the manager about our concern he let us know he would take off the tab the "shots" we ordered. I felt cheated because his intention was to charge us $10 a shot when 14 is the 25 were water. It was bizarre and rude. I love this restaurant but Mike would not take responsibility for what happened when we were kind customers with a brunch party of 25 people... very disappointed.   BUT our server Jordan was great, very professional and a hard worker!

6bHcmtvTHfa0gPnLPesE4Q.text: I felt it was a little over-rated but beautiful interior. However, I would come back more often with business clients and old friends but it is much too loud with the music they blast there, so much so that you can't have a good conversation. If they went down a notch in volume and sampled trip-hop, downbeat or chill music would be the best of all worlds for me.

fi7kPPoInZsOFjUVfhMOtw.text: Perfect Birthday Dinner!  My daughter and her boyfriend treated me to a wonderful dinner here.  Our server, Felipe, provided us with the best dining experience by being attentive without hovering.  When something was needed, Felipe seemed to know and came by.  We shared many different items, with some of the favorites being the rock shrimp, miso eggplant, and a sushi roll.   The dessert was a sampler we all shared that came with a birthday candle.  Lovely evening!

20eH4rh5tHFG_AIitQotmw.text: Every time I travel to Scottsdale I try to stop in here. Excellent food full of flavor and diversity. The sea bass is great. Great selection of foods and beverages. The atmosphere is high energy and can get loud at times.

RGHJ9w-uPvc6po9RIu3EyQ.text: This place is delicious. It is one of my favorite brunch spots. The food is good and the mimosas are better. Be sure to ask for josh as your waiter, he's guaranteed to make your experience even better!

Tl_227jMQ4XsDE7mbrrLbA.text: Literally great experience our waiter josh was everything we needed. Great time fast service he's the best if you come to SumoMaya get josh he's the best!

hsyjvfJdKXrBWK6bs91Mzg.text: Upon walking in you can't help notice the tree centered in the restaurant, I love the look and vibe of this place.  My friend and I started with some drinks, we got the Sumo-Rita and the Loaded Mule. My loaded mule was pretty good, the flavor profile of cucumber with passionfruit, seemed like a really good twist on typical Moscow Mule. Don't get me wrong, it was good but it just didn't really wow me as much as I had hoped. The Sumo-Rita was really refreshing and light, it was so good!   For food we got the crab guacamole, shishito roll, rock shrimp tempura roll, coconut ahi tuna tartar and the pork belly ramen. It probably seems like a lot of food but the portions are somewhat on the small side and we really wanted to try a variety of things.   The Shishito roll was really average, and although the the ingredients seem really unique it sort of just over complicates things. You'd think a roll with shishito peppers, kiwi-mango sauce, avocado and salmon would be really complex but all you end up tasting is a slight bitterness from the peppers and mango.  The rock shrimp tempura roll was somewhat like your normal shrimp tempura roll but dressed up a bit. Not bad by any means but I'd try other items if I ever came back. The crab guac was okay but it was kinda bland. The crab was just put on top and seemed like an afterthought.   The coconut tuna tartar was pretty good, the coconut wasn't over powering, super crispy plantain chip and bonus points because the presentation was gorgeous. The pork belly ramen was unexpectedly my favorite dish I tried that night. The pork belly was super tender while the broth was really deep with pork and mushroom flavor.   Overall the SumoMaya was pretty good. Although some of the food we got was average there were so many items on the menu that seems interesting I'd probably come back to try new things.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Coconut Ahi Tuna Tartar
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Loaded Mule and Sumo-Rita!

XjBLj9wmdR3h11J9Mo-bmQ.text: This was such a cool place. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was great.  I was disappointed when they were out of the lobster roll I ordered but everything else was good! Will recommend to friends next time they are in the area.

DB4trlxvEgThEw3q1ChP0A.text: The atmosphere really helped to make my experience here even more enjoyable. The service was the best I have had in a long time. The staff was great. Our table ordered cocktails, the spicy tuna roll, guacamole, chicken tacos and the fried rice. The tostada that comes with the guac was way over seasoned. We also felt that the tacos were lacking a little flavor. Other than that everything was good and we will come back. The set up was perfect for people watching lol. We really enjoyed the music selection by the DJ. Food pictured below.

F9YbG9Xug6G1W_AJZoTs_g.text: Few places really deliver on 'Asian Fusion', and SumoMaya was one of those that didn't. The 'fusion' dishes just tasted like asian food gone awry.   We started with the the Pumpkin Seed Guacamole which was good, but nothing particularly different/unique I was excited about the Sushis since they seemed really interesting, but the Soft Shelled Crab roll just didn't deliver. I'm normally someone who loves all the specialty sushi rolls I eat, but the flavor combinations just didn't match up and notes accentuated in the wrong places.  We also tried the Al Pastor Pad Thai. My fiancee loves pad thai and loves his Al Pastor, but again the medley just didn't work for us.  The only dish we liked was our side - the Miso Eggplant, which was well flavored.   Great cocktail, margarita, beer and wine menu. I liked my Coconut cocktail which kind of tasted like a melted pina colada.  We also felt we overpaid for the quality and taste of the food. $80 for not enjoying our main dishes was not a good eal. Too many other great small plates places in the Scottsdale area.   The ambience is also confusing. It's swanky and would be a neat place to hang out but it was also trying too hard to be a Vegas nightclub. There's a DJ on his laptop upon entry, playing club music that made me want to dance on the tables, but also sports showing on TVs above the bar.  Not a good place for a first date or anything where you want to hear the other person.

SYWXtlz1T91m7gRrwPgrZQ.text: Sunday brunch with all you can eat and drink! Amazing spot with a cool vibe and great food.

PRb-OM2U86Kc1Iue1Tk-dA.text: A quintessential Scottsdale restaurant. Big, loud and a place to be seen. The food is not bad, either. Always a good choice for those looking for an example of the local scene.

ml-6M3WlQq375K54Z__gxA.text: Made a reservation 4 days prior on open table.  When we arrived they only offered us outdoor seating when it was close to 100 degrees outside and did not even offer to allow us to wait for an inside table.  Said they cant guarantee tables inside.  Decided to leave rather than eat outside in the heat, would recommend you make sure they guarantee you an inside table if you make a reservation here in the summer.

hCnObuKURf3VOxCTyWfiXg.text: Weekend bottomless brunch is a good idea, but the execution is not on par. The service is so slow, the concept is that you can order anything on the menu for $30. However, your wait staff disappears for such long periods that you're only able to order the bare minimum before giving up and asking for your check, which is then hand carved into stone before being brought to your table. Make sure you have hours before going here!!!

k7GkaxCTnkpnce_6lBJ75g.text: Amazing! To start, we had the seared tuna and guc w squash and other mix in.  We had the lobster mango roll and spicy crab roll.  It was the best sushi I've ever had.  Then we had Mari Mari tacos which were also out of this world. Delicious unique cocktails too and fair pricing. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

_c9vZk4hPq7Md8z8j7l8hA.text: We went during the end of happy hour...the bar was crowded and service was good.  Unfortunately, the appetizers fell short of what we expected.  The drinks were a little off too.  Maybe just a bad time but we hesitate returning.   It is on the pricy side so we expected above the curve.

026cHMcZTakFe2u2tSFfUQ.text: Ok. Loved the ambiance, but for what the menu was,  felt it was a tad over priced for the breakfast brunch. Added the drinks for and extra $10. That was worth it because we drank the heck out of those! Lol. Everything was tasty except my main meal, the wagyu beef was over cooked, tough,  and bland.  The price and over cooked meal is why I gave it 3 stars.

LuJHGW6T9eOgsmpKUz1TQg.text: BEST brunch spot in Scottsdale. PHENOMENAL service & positive vibes. Our server was amazing!! His name is Juan- the absolute kindest, most accommodating human ever. Come here, you won't regret it!!

YcQQ5TCH5D5WT9WoQ4frNQ.text: I've eaten at SumoMaya before and loved the ambience and food. Not only do they do a stellar job at Japanese- Mexican fusion, but they also achieve an eclectic Alice-in-Wonderland type of feel, with a tree in the middle of the restaurant and hot pink chairs and portraits of Japanese and Mexican ancestors sprinkled everywhere. Aside from this, they also have a killer brunch. I had heard through friends that the brunch at SumoMaya was amazing, but they absolutely defied my expectations.  First of all they take the concept of bottomless brunch from drinks and apply it to food. But what results is not some boring breakfast buffet-like meal - it's better. The structure of the meal is three courses, with unlimited ordering for the first course and the third course. What exactly does this mean? All you can eat dessert, and all you can eat apps! Oh, and all you can eat sides, too if your stomach can handle it.  For apps they have everything from sushi rolls to pomegranate guac to chorizo scramble. If you don't already fill up on these, because they are divine, then you can move on to your entree. The entree list is overwhelming. It took us about ten minutes to order because we just could not decide. There is everything from sweet potato waffles to a Cubano sandwich to coconut pancakes with spicy mangos. We finally ordered the salmon omelette and the wagyu steak with the poached egg. Oh my gosh the salmon melted in my mouth! My only critique was the steak was a little over-seasoned but we ate everything anyway. And holy cow, how we had room for dessert I'll never know but the cheesecake is like biting into light, creamy deliciousness. (It's still healthy because it comes with fruit right? Because we definitely capitalized on the unlimited on this one...) Overall, this is the best deal ever, it's only $29 for the meal itself and an extra $10 if you want the unlimited drinks. I'm so excited to go back and try other items on the menu!

DvU3D5nihULy7X4siTquxQ.text: Design and atmosphere is great, service is good, food is good, but I wouldn't eat there everyday.

znjUxxO37xMX__zy8sbL4A.text: Food and atmosphere was amazing! The food is on the pricier side of $$, not it was delicious! The carne asada guacamole was my favorite thing that we ordered, but the al pastor was Pad Thai was great too. The sumo 75 cocktail was worth the $12!

n24qUOVhaSppMFgJAXskiw.text: The service was amazing; personable and authentic, not overbearing or fake. Food was good, not destination setting. So very overpriced. Almost like they think expensive means trendy. I like the concept of Japanese-Mexican fusion, but unrealistic in sustainable pricing. I'd go back if the price-point met the product.

BoYiIMqU_hBEDidEXHul1Q.text: You will never ever experience a BRUNCH the way that SumoMaya does it, it's not only has a very unique menu, but the food is tasty and freakin delicious and the environment is fantastic inside the  restaurant and if I recall they even had LIVE music, seriously, check this place out, it's my favorite!

ien7lsZ0gdf9iFEfMAzivA.text: Food--interesting combinations and flavors! Loved the bacon-wrapped dates and enjoyed the Korean Beef tacos as well as the Pork Belly sushi roll.  My favorite item was the Sizzling Chaufa Rice--such unique flavors!  Not very happy with the lobster ceviche (a bit tough and no crisps or bread or chips to scoop it up with) and very disappointed with the Pina Colada dessert (tough pineapple and cake was small and rubbery; coconut sorbet was yummy though and they did take it off the menu).  Finally, the margaritas were so small and two of them in succession did not even get me a little bit buzzed (for $24 I expect some jazz).  The atmosphere is cool -- love the tree but it's very loud after 7 pm when Sir Mix-A lot starts playing the tunes (Saturday) and the hard plastic chairs are horrible!  Our service was fine but I thought the food came out a bit quickly.  Overall, I can't really say I'll be returning anytime soon.

QOBbRng43tJam0v7jYc8DQ.text: Took some out of townees their on a Saturday early evening.  The place was packed.  Great vibe.  They loved the Japanese Mexican combo.  They had and love the Sushi, I had rice with chicken that had an egg on top.  Passed in on Scottsdale for years without paying much attention.  Was very surprised by it upon entering.  Do yourself a favor and try it.

tM19k5HGInfpYtMasbCqGQ.text: SumoMaya came recommended by my wife's co-worker. The spicy tuna roll was so amazing that I ordered another! The pad Thai was the best my wife and I have ever had! Korean BBQ tacos were good as well! Service was top notch! It was loud inside but all together amazing place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

N42p_i5vjKiSSkBGUYonWw.text: The best service and food I've had in a while. We live in San Diego where we are saturated with new concepts and cool new spots that just don't pan out. I can tell you that dinner, lunch, brunch or happy hour here is a must! Our servers ( I could of sworn we had multiple servers  because of all the attention on our table) were amazing! We started with recommended cocktails, and beers. I had the shogun (was amazing) and my girlfriend had the new skinny margarita. A party in her mouth!! They have a stellar tequila collection and we definitely delved into it. I highly  recommend the carne asada and the street corn (with popcorn!) My girl had the white fish ceviche and she was amazed! Best place to ever celebrate my buddies birthday and me receiving my doctorate! Dan our server was the cherry on top of our experience!

1ITd7Lq-9L5JRJ4QWtdrsw.text: Fun atmosphere! Came here for a friends birthday with about 12 people and service was great. Always hard doing tapas style with a large party but everything was so good we could t complain. Pomegranate guacamole is out of this world, seriously considering a take out order for just that. I don't eat sushi but a lot of my friends did and raves about it. Finer fried rice was amazing, with just the right amount of finger. Chicken tacos were also great to my pleasant surprise. Overall a great experience and fun time. A little pricey with drinks and food but great for a night out with friends or date.

osM7m1JwzBvEQs5ccwuP9A.text: Food here is really really good and the pokey martini that I'm not sure if they still serve was absolutely delicious amazing soup as well to thumbs up hands-down

HbbxLB7mf1NFj9IT0aF33A.text: Trendy fusion restaurant that has a good vibe if you want to drink and be seen. We ordered several dishes and they were very hit or miss. Most of the dishes were doused in oil and sauce which ruined the ingredients. If you're trying to dine for dinner your probably need a reservation as the place gets packed. The service was pretty good which I've come to expect from most restaurants at this price point in Scottsdale.

1-SVbLt7-zgBB9Y_KiatGg.text: Unfortunately, I felt like the brunch was overrated. The quality of food was lacking for $29 a person, not to mention the unlimited drinks for $10. You aren't able to switch between beverages on the list, so if one drinks mimosas, you drink the mimosas the entire time. They tasted like Andre with a watered down juice mixture.   The food was not unique or satisfying. We ordered sushi rolls which ended up being pretty much vegetarian with the minute slice of salmon in one piece. As for the entrees, I can make better hollandaise sauce at home. The dessert was, however, satisfying- a creamy uncaramelized creme brulee wth fresh fruit.  When looking at quality vs quantity, SumoMaya fails in both areas. This is a place where they want you to think it's high class with the prices, but don't waste your money.

gg9_ub22IjpFLkUCj879Bg.text: I really like this place. I like the decor and I like the funky Asian/Mexican infusion food that they have. Their brunch is really good too - just a bit loud with the DJ to talk to your friends. Being able to get some good pad thai and good sushi is awesome. Their staff is always really nice and friendly. The last visit we sat at the bar and the bartender was super helpful with picking some Sake and we met the bar manager I believe too, and he was great as well. Definitely a spot to regularly go to.

g7Qn10e3th_GmF4xLJYDqA.text: Delicious sushi, excellent vibe and music- looking forward to returning. Excellent service and DJ with enjoyable music

Cw6ie9m8tz78RuOFoBM0rw.text: This place is amazing! The brunch is to die for! I absolutely loved the fried rice, fruit & yogurt platter, Mexican bread, the Pad Thai, everything! The only issue we had was when we were seated, we were never told that we couldn't order a la carte, unless we were seated at the bar. Our waitress was so nice though and talked to her manager so the people in my party who wanted a la carte could have it. For the brunch it was endless sides/starters, and they were amazing. Unfortunately though we didn't receive all of them. When we told our waitress this, she claimed she brought them to us, when really, we never received them. She then fixed it and brought the food we didn't get. It's ok though, the food is amazing and I will definitely return for dinner. The atmosphere is gorgeous too! :)

ogSiY9rTS5Y-45hYtYbW4Q.text: Al Pastor Pad Thai is the best creation ever! Had dinner at this place while on vacation and I can't stop thinking about how badly I want a SumoMaya in NYC! These flavors together are a match made in heaven.

IoZmBzfpTBcyflKj7_c0qQ.text: One word for the all you can eat brunch... AMAZING!   Service was great and food came out relatively fast for how busy they were.   I will be coming back whenever I visit Scottsdale.

7pFfN-XsjU8YVPKa6urOQQ.text: Service was slow. Waited 25 mins for scrambled eggs. GM came over a couple of times to ask how everything was going & when we informed her that we've been waiting for a while on eggs, she apologized but said nothing else. One good thing I should mention though, is they let us bring home leftovers from our endless brunch.

8HXw-r-Z-kX-Td4aEVz9mQ.text: We had a great experience at SumoMaya. Our waiter Phillipe was awesome. Food and drinks were exactly what we had hoped for!

pGI7ETHv-WPEsWMNnVvp5w.text: Waited for our confirmed reservation for 40 min, saw other parties getting seated, left without eating dinner, management was less than apologetic, did not offer any help in resolving the issue

Gvjrymy-ZDevQ64JUwjPOg.text: I had been waiting for this restaurant to open because I believe that Asian and Latin food fusion makes a great combination.  We went there first for happy hour; since I couldn't stay long, I ordered the mushroom tacos.  The mushrooms were delicious but nothing on the menu said it would be spicy - but it was VERY spicy.  Finally figured out that the onions are pickled with serrano chilis and that's probably what I bit into that made the taco so SPICY. Next time, I asked that they "hold" anything spicy but the kitchen can't seem to know what is spicy and and what is not.  According the bartender: "Well, what's spicy to you, may not be spicy to them" and that's when I decided that as good as a couple of the dishes I've had, it wasn't going to be the next great find in my list. The kitchen can manage to make the Pad Thai al Pastor mild enough for me to enjoy and in another visit I also enjoyed the Chicharron de Pollo that I ordered and shared with my friend.  She ordered the Bacon Wrapped Medjool Dates.  The Guacamoles were not dissappointing but again, very spicy.  We tried the Lump Crab and Bacon. There was one dish (I believe it was the meatballs with soup) that apparently taken out of the menu because in the 5 times I went there, they were never serving it. I will likely go again as it seems to be popular with my friends but unfortunately, not the place I expected.

ls43aTxdHsw_8YF4e4c2yg.text: Came here with my family after they had heard great things about it.  I wasn't impressed...nor were they.  Sorry for not having more detail...place was pretty forgettable...average food, service, experience

F515Ur0u41OCKfNucM4M9g.text: From the outside this place doesn't look like anything special, but once you walk through the doors - holy cow what a fun environment! It has quite the "clubby" feel for a restaurant but it worked. Asian Mexican fusion food you say... what?? I was so confused how it would work, but my guacamole went surprisingly well with the pad thai and sushi rolls. Despite having a HUGE group (we were in town for SB49) our waitress was a GEM! She was so sweet and patient with all the orders, although some didn't make it out when we wanted, she took great care of us - I tasted quite a plethora of different dishes and they were all equally delicious. Any chance I'm back in this area, I'll definitely be back! Minus the terrible Pat's fans of course. ;)

WZ7x10pYVv0kmPLeZjthNg.text: I don't have anything negative to say about this place. My friend Toby works here so I'm slightly biased but for good reasons. Yes, this place is TRENDY and fits right into Scottsdale. Come dressed up! Love the comp. valet! Great service all around! The reverse happy hour starts later then most places though, but not a big deal. I had some of the freshest salmon here in my roll and the rice was still warm when it was served! I loved each of their tacos, as well. I will be back soon!

Rtb8dyRNSlQlx586Qhu_PA.text: Went here for happy hour one night. Good luck trying to get a seat at the bar which you have to be at in order to get the happy hour prices. The tacos were good and reasonably priced but the drinks were way over priced even on happy hour. It's an older crowd with mostly Cougars on the prowl. Shame because I really wanted to love this place but we won't be back.

NONwbctqZf4zxkOoxQwdTg.text: I had an awesome experience at this cool new fusion restaurant in Scottsdale.A group of us tried a lot from the menu including the fried rice, pad thai, sea bass pork belly..you get the idea. Every dish was served on a well presented plate and was equally delicious. Im picky about rice and their version was a nice mix of Mexican spice and Asian elegance. Every dish was cooked to perfection. The pork belly was a treat and the sea bass went really fast. If you're feeling decadent, and I often am when I'm out, try the billionaire roll. Way overpriced kobe beef roll that includes gold flake..Had to have it and it was stellar! Our server was busy but efficient and friendly. The patio was comfortable and had a nice selection of attractive Scottsdalites. Great new addition to the scene.

cF8UdYuv4DQU6MOXOo4Jtw.text: If there was 4.5 stars, I'd give this place that since I wasn't a fan of the Skinny Margarita. But the food was AMAZING so that made up for it. We had the Chinese-Style Chile-Crab Garlic Noodles, which were great and reminded my boyfriend of the food he used to have growing up. We also had the Korean tacos which were great, as were the mussels--I'm a huge mussels fan. The ambience was great (LOVED the decor) except the fact that we were seated outside in the summer in Phoenix and it wasn't quite cool enough on the patio for that...but we got over it.

6NRYQErw6X4UW9v1u5Bp6Q.text: I'm not sure what's better: the eclectic food options or the people watching. Expect unique Mexican/asian fusion food, great bar space with huge TVs and Vegas-esque interiors (there's a tree in the middle of the restaurant). Guac with crab, specialty margaritas, garlic noodles, tacos (which are very reasonably priced) were all hits with me. This would be a fun place to take out of town guests as it does bring in a quintessentially Scottsdale crowd PLUS it's a local pick as all Osio restaurants currently operate in Scottsdale or Phoenix.

GpqIhRY6hRib1A3f922s8g.text: Wow, I had the Arroz Con Pato, amazing dish. The chef who thought of it should be awarded. Also had a hand roll and Korean Beef tacos, good also but not worth writing home about.

hVxvQLkCCYN2ZeGJ4zFunA.text: It scares me that the guy behind the sushi bar has a foot long beard. There are probably little hairs falling in food.. Disgusting. The owner should have a policy requiring that people (anyone handling food with hearty facial hair) wear a cover / hair net contraption as protection. I love this place but Jesus Christ cover that thing.

Xv2lJHuaoevv306i5f6Kpw.text: There is a lot going on at SumoMaya which mostly is good.  We had a party of 6 and it was lateish for lunch but the staff seemed pretty accommodating.  My husband and I had early dinner plans and had joined 2 other couples for this outing kind of just to get out and about in Phoenix.  It seemed at first tlike we weren't going to get the best service but once we all got settled our server was on top of everything...and my anxiety of not getting to our dinner at another friends house went down.    Anyway, the decor is really fun, bright colors and patterns, eclectic and cool with a lot of the latest (ghost chairs, ethnic striped backs for the booths, wood and metal) accents.  Two really cool decor items are the breathable walls made of faux ivy and the mirrors in the bathrooms made out of succulents.  Really fun. The food was amazing.  We didn't eat a lot (early dinner) but we tried everything the table ordered.  Two of the best:  Rock Shrimp Tempura and Shaking Beef.   It's lively and fun which always makes for a better experience with friends.

ZanMIQtd7xktpgTrBm4NRg.text: Amazing food and great service!!! The manager was very kind and the atmosphere was awesome. Get the Ahi Tuna appetizer

FFcBFkK-D4N5G-_EVKytog.text: Love the vibe of the restaurant. Came in with my mother, father, and baby sister. They were able to tweak a dish for the baby to make sure she could eat with the rest of us. I had the rock shrimp(must have) and the tuna tacos. All the portions are small but delicious. If you are looking to fill up without spending very much this is not the place for you. I enjoyed the food as did the rest of the family. The downfall is the server was barely there. I don't like my meals rushed but it was to the point I didn't get to order a drink until 20 minutes in. Despite that I will definitely be back. Probably without the baby this time! Overall good time.

0Yi49SdlzBTkF7pREZILrQ.text: They do a good job, a lot of interesting combinations, fun  atmosphere...

7U6tAmBm21KfeWAdAL40Ng.text: Great service and food! Ceviche of the day was so good and mussels are amazing! Get extra bread to soak up that sauce!!!

qhUl156e5JkUgKDjVaMbQA.text: Fantastically hip spot.  Fusion between Mexican and Japanese food was awesome.  Highly recommended!

tqhJHmnEHC9nAwjbgAOswg.text: Not quite sure about the menu.  The pork belly noodles were so bland.  But the spicy tuna tacos were very good.  Other items were equally hit and miss.  Skip the desserts.  The decor was eclectic and fun.  Early on the vibe was great for families and couples alike.  We were 2 couples and liked the date nite appeal.

sxf_JFztwOWrA2BxfWKnCQ.text: We've been going here since it opened. If i had written the review last year I would have definitely given them 5 stars. Food was always amazing as well as the service. I have to say, in the past few months the food tastes different. Not everything, but most items we have ordered no longer taste like they used to. The waiter suggested that it possibly has to do with some items now being gluten free?? The only item that still tastes the same and is delicious is the bacon guacamole. Always amazing and I highly recommend trying it! Everything is just blah. The service the past few times we've been has been soso.

ZiuH-iNS3rgBTs9Q1wTkYA.text: I didn't have high expectations for such an unusual type of fusion food, but I thought SumoMaya was great.  We mostly had Mexican cuisine (ceviche, tacos) all of which was excellent. I deducted a star for our somewhat pretentious server, who didn't write down our order and then forgot two of our dishes.  I reminded him, and then he only brought one of them, then had our table cleared and asked if we wanted dessert. We said no, and as he was walking away, a waiter walked towards our table with our salad (the missing dish).  Our server whispered in his ear and sent him away.  Did he really think we didn't notice/forgot?  The right thing to do would have been to apologize and ask if we still wanted the dish.  Some maturity and grace, rather than trying to save face, would have gone much farther.

_yYRLj43XERAo-NWsGHTYA.text: The food was very good, the service was fabulous, the decor delightful. But at $50 without tip for two for lunch (iced teas, no alcohol), I won't be back unless it's a special occasion.

B-XBEZ6sS66HKpZNpnplQw.text: Meh... so many better options for sushi or brunch in Scottsdale.  Decor cool but, no reason to pay for food with so many issues from served cold, to enchiladas missing cheese, to pieces of paper from the kitchen food ticket in your meal.  May have been a one time flop but, enough to keep our group away due to other choices in area with supreme service and food.

4WtEwh7UiHA8RSAV9HXvZQ.text: Amazing!! Will be back many more times. Tuna ceviche and Rollo ching on were to die for!

55xtYXme7QoTS3pOk_PGiA.text: This should only be a one-star shop, but for the fast and friendly greeters who sat us down right away. EVERYTHING after that went the opposite of good. The servings are mostly symbolic, we brought an appetite and left hungry. The battered cod tacos were tiny enough to be called taquitos with something resembling a fish stick in the center. I also had some unagi sushi and this unagi was poorly prepared. The waitress took the time to deride us at the end of our meal, mentioning that we should probably have ordered some sandwiches instead. The price tag was unreal, I felt ashamed for inviting a good friend along because he thought he's paying for the entire bill even though we went dutch. Pricey, tiny portions, lackluster service. Overall, I wish I never went there, period!

1qHpieEI7QTiGoYHDE91zg.text: This is a really awesome fusion restaurant. The popcorn made with tajin and truffle oil is so worth it for the flavor combination. The chicken and Korean beef tacos are bomb.com. Our bartender/server was Erika, she was very informative and let us know about all of the ingredients and flavors in our choices! Ps;get the popcorn

qu4fdtfHrSuVq-HQzbhT_g.text: Went there Friday for meal of 8.  Very noisy, loud music also.  A place for the young at heart or just young.  They suggest you share dishes. The catch is: they want you to buy more meals.  For a table of 4, they might suggest 6 entrees or you better be light eaters.

8aAzl5pIQzO2YrsdYIZtjQ.text: Went there a couple of weeks ago with my good friend who has finally decided to give sushi a try. I did have a couple of rolls, but my favorite was the Rollo Chingon; Spanish for Badass Roll.  You have to try the Guacamole, I forgot if they put crab or oysters on it, but worth the shot. But, wasn't too thrilled with the noodles we ordered. Nonetheless, a great scene and the staff was very friendly. Will return for sure.

H4iZBk-Rmxz1u1sPrXSl5g.text: Came in for brunch over the weekend with the kids as most restaurants that serve brunch are family friendly,  this place certainly is not.  The decor was fun and inviting when you first walk but then it turned to awkwardness once we were sat.  My child's high chair was very dirty and required us to clean it before letting him in.  Our server was nice,  somewhat knowledgeable and the food was ok,  but lukewarm.  The overall experience was really a downer listening to some vulgar woman in the kitchen slam stuff around. Do you really think we want our kids to hear you say f-this f-this throughout our ENTIRE meal. What should be a relaxing morning out turned into a waste of a hundred dollar meal.

dXmJWq0tTFqp_h9wDUP9Fw.text: Great happy hour menu. Speciality cocktails were good and the bacon wrapped dates were delish! The service was amazing! Chelsea our waitress was very attentive and friendly, she gave us a lot of really good recommendations. Definitely will be back!

eMtCRTJPwFMlRNKoK0CXog.text: Booked an 8:30 reservation for 9 people not knowing the restaurant closed at 9. At 9:30 we were told last call for food and alcohol. They were not willing to stay open to accommodate us knowing weeks ahead with a pre ordered menu we were here for a bachelorette party. Service was rushed and unorganized. Drinks were brought out one at a time and plates were cleared slowly albeit being finished for a long time. Had to ask multiple times for water refill. Food was decent but, disappointing experience overall.

c7ohNd7VyfO5s9DNTRf8QQ.text: Dates - Excellent  Spiced Popcorn - ok Shishito peppers - Excellent  Chic garron de Pollo - Not great Mushroom tacos - ok Salmon avocado - good Ckn taco - not good  Miso eggplant - yum Cal hand roll - yum

uIpyj7OT12YXnzKWsaoBVw.text: I really liked the pad Thai.  The softshell crab blt was ok but I won't order it again.

zadH2KrmqHC5wBj_6FNUqA.text: This place is really cool.  The environment and ambiance is very upbeat and creative.  A really nice place.  The food was very flavorful and unique.  Don't expect to get full on one dish though.  Tried about three different things before not being hungry anymore.  I believe that is the style of this place though.  Went on a Friday night and the clientele were all over 28 years old, clean, and dressed nicely.  Seemed like the cool, trendy place to go in Scottsdale.

0onM1rdN9RKZVMq-MIJS_Q.text: This place is awesome!  All four of my party ordered something different.  We shared and everything was good.  Great atmosphere too

IAbEaq7wah6zzTLLkdMJKA.text: Came in for my first time Saturday night and had a great meal. Out of the three signature sumo rolls I shared with my dad, I have to say the Red Dragon roll was the best. Apparently its a secret menu item and the sushi chefs don't like making it so hopefully I don't get in trouble for talking about it but it's exceptional. Definitely worth trying if you're looking for good food and a cool atmosphere. Pretty nice bar as well.

FAif2falRxwrjDdDrtpBpw.text: Delicious!  The food was not cheap, but it was worth every penny. The combination of ingredients and flavors is surprising & well matched, producing a unique and delicious outcome. Every bite was a party in my mouth. It instantly went to the top of my favorite restaurants list

ExdpqmRVNHywqrrVklUSvw.text: We really enjoyed our meal here. Fushion style - elements of Japanese and Mexican cooking. Need to know what to order to optimize the experience of the fusion menu. We Ordered several items to share, probably one dish too much. Renegade kitchen style - food comes out when ready. Ramen with melt in your mouth Pork Belly, noodles and an egg. The ramen was hearty and outstanding. Couldn't get enough of it and I continue to crave it. Also had soft shell crab sushi roll with Jabanero-Mango Sauce-  the pepper gave it a nice kick, as I am usually not too into sweet tastes overpowering my sushi. We ordered a soft shell Korean Beef Taco, 2 come with one order. They are small, but delicious. Guacamole selection is different here, you can get it with lump crab meat, chicharone, catija cheese, or corn, with house made tortilla flats for dipping. Place has a really cool vibe, and a tree grows in the middle.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Creative Cocktail Selection. Try one of SumoMaya&#39;s takes on a myle or saki with sushi- can&#39;t go wrong
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Soft Shell Crab Sushi with Jabanero-Mango Sauce
Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tacos.

n6O8MJyGG6juJrb60tZv3A.text: Came in with a group for lunch. They have a fun atmosphere and interesting menu. Food is reasonably priced. The different guacamoles they have were a lot of fun and seemed to be a hit with everyone.

dAE9QabS3lXex6ctpikCGw.text: So Hubby and I decided to swing in to Sumo after a theater matinee to check out the Happy Hour. Were really glad we went the cheap-o route -- spending less on drinks and appetizers than we normally spend on wine, alone, at other places! -- because it was really hit-and-miss.   Free valet parking is a nice touch before you even walk in.    All the high-tops were taken, so we sat at the bar and encountered really disappointing service. Seemed the bartender was overwhelmed, both with the territory she had to cover and hiccups coming from the kitchen, so she wasn't the most welcoming sort.  Roasted pineapple marg and passion fruit sangria were nice. We tried three different types of tacos, all of which were good. The spicy tuna roll we had was, well, a spicy tuna roll...I was expecting something inventive, and didn't get it. The chicken chicharones were terrible -- basically just pieces of dry, unseasoned chicken breast rolled in corn meal and fried. The sauce they came with wasn't enough to overcome the dish's other shortcomings.  The place is clearly a magnet for 20-something tourists and Botox addicts, which though slightly weird is also mildly entertaining. I suppose we might come back for the cheap eats, but...probably not.

4rcf3zXDup7VeQIB5KcD4A.text: Full flavor and Kambucha Ginger beer.  Son had the Garlic Crab Noodles and I had the Chicken Mole...flavor explosion.  Started with the Dried Fruit Guacamole...so good.

dYQFNUMP4IOYx2g0pDxpmw.text: Beautiful decor !!! Our waitress was very attentive and friendly , great mood setting , and the food taste awesome ! My first time in Phoenix and glad I picked this place for dinner !!!

f3-acrzMkgLtPLO8yuLmhQ.text: I just love this place! Great for families, too. Food is delicious. I have yet to have anything on the menu that I did not like. Always a winner.

fU3g3mi4-yciiMpUlj2Png.text: I went to brunch here today and absolutely loved it.  The service was excellent. The food was great and the beer selection is great. I will be back!

7i6SuvNNxIqvBr7_Nntsog.text: Our server nick was so nice! We were a big group of girls and he was super patient and helpful and attentive. The food was fantastic. Everyone please order the arroz verde. Also the surprise birthday dessert was fantastic. Nothing but good things to say:)

ajKNHjHUKfiZJMe2lbswJQ.text: I ate here just over two years ago, and loved it.  Since I was back in town, thought I would go again!  And it was still amazing!  Make sure you make a reservation, still a very popular place in Scottsdale.

SGb92_W5vrOMNDP41t30RA.text: Met a girlfriend for dinner & drinks (my first time here) & loved it so much, hubby and I are now going for date night. Great atmosphere, stellar food, & awesome service. The Cali Roll is the best I've ever had; can't wait to try other menu items.

ycF-wy09YT-Jzj3VZJHbRA.text: Don't get the hype most of what I ordered was on the Mexican side of menu so not sure if there sushi is what there know for. First came for my bday and candeled another resv to go here. It was one of the fastest meals I've ever had very rushed seemed like stuff was pre made even tho I don't believe it was but still nothing flavorful at all. Would like to point out one highlight of the meal but there was one maybe the cocktail.  Service was okay but once again very very rushed.

wwjGcbJc_Wk8464JhPgx9Q.text: Great spot! Always lively. Great food. Got rock is my personal favorite. Great cocktails. Finally a fun restaurant to go to in paradise valley area.

ls0yuJVNxSg3oNwWhP81Pw.text: No no no!!! This place is just the worst. Now listen here, I am by no way a cheapskate when it comes to grub. I have many times spent a little over $100 for dinner for two, and when the food is special or just good I have no problem or regrets, but this place???   My wife ordered a chicken fried rice and it was good, as good as you can get at Panda Express or any Teriyaki Bowl place, but it cost double here, $12, no biggie, its a nice place.   I ordered the Tokyo Mule, it was a good drink, just as good as I have gotten at The Vig or any other restaurant bar pretty much... also $12, Ok ok, normally anywhere else they are $8 $9 or $10 tops I understand that they have to pay for the tree inside and the faces on the chairs, understandable.   This is the kicker, I ordered chicken tinga tacos, 2 for $8. Now when you say tacos in the usa my mind goes to the standard taco bell or del taco size soft tortilla. When my plate arrived (see picture attached) my eyes just opened wide, I couldnt belive what I was seeing and my wife looked at me anc chuckled, the "tacos" where not even the size of the palm of my hand, one bite literally and they were gone, the taste? Nothing special I cant get at Paquime or any other of the newish midscale hopster mexican food places that have popped up, these were 50 cent tacos at best.  My conclusion?, the tacos really ticked me off, just because you're in Scottsdale doesnt mean you can rip off people, heck! I've been to restautrants in Scottsdale where I have to take a to go box. If you have money to splurge and dont mind overpaying for small portions of food that tou can get somewhere else at lower prices and greater quantities then by all means, come to SumoMaya.  Oh, the service was great! Good fast service.

photos.caption: Photo of SumoMaya - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not even the size of my palm, literally the smallest tacos Ive ever seen. These $8 tacos are 50 cent tacos at best

vLWQYVDX9ZtrcMx0rWkg2A.text: This was my first time at SumoMaya and was not familiar with their menu. I was greeted with free valet and was seated in a very comfortable corner table for 2. The waiter was not only delightful but knowledgeable about everything on the menu. We started the dinner with an order of Mexican street corn which came decorated with popcorn. It was slightly hot but in the most amazing way. Next ordered 2 al pastor tacos and 2 pescado tacos. Both selections were delicious and simply just fresh on each ingredient. For my drink I ordered the Tokyo mule which came with a lil kick in it as well and in an very enjoyable way. Finished with arroz marisco dish that the waiter brought out in an artistic looking pot. Mixed the fried egg with a large spoon and this combination of flavors made out to be the reason why I'll return. The scenery is beautiful but the food is the real winner here
